Title: Data Analyst Intern, EMEA
Description:
What You'll Do:

As a member of our Solutions & Innovation Analytics team, you won't just analyze data; you'll be the cornerstone that connects groundbreaking ideas with real-world business applications. Here, your expertise will not only shape solutions but also empower our clients and commercial teams to make impactful decisions.

What You'll Do:


Data-Driven Innovation: Leverage cutting-edge tech like Hadoop, Vertica, Tableau, Git, Python, and SQL to transform complex business challenges into groundbreaking solutions.
Collaboration at Its Core: Work side by side with cross-functional teams to deliver insights that not only drive revenue but also foster client success.
Tech Playground: Immerse yourself in an environment where experimenting with advanced analytics tools isn't just encouraged, it's part of your daily work.
Diverse Projects: From user need identification to scaling complex data solutions, your role will be dynamic, impactful, and full of opportunities to innovate.



Who You Are:


A problem-solver with a passion for analytics and a logical approach to challenges.
Interested in solving data problems using Python & SQL, and enthusiastic about automating and scaling solutions.
Business-minded with a goal to turn data insights into actionable strategies.
Team player who thrives in a collaborative, inclusive, and vibrant workspace.
Fluent in English and skilled at simplifying complex concepts for diverse audiences.
Eligible to work in Spain with no restrictions.



Your Work Environment:


State-of-the-art open office with a cozy, collaborative vibe.
Flexible remote working options - balance your life the way you want.
A tech-forward, primarily digital workspace.
Choose your hours: start early or a bit later, as long as the work's done.
Need special work hours? Let's talk about it!



We acknowledge that many candidates may not meet every single role requirement listed above. If your experience looks a little different from our requirements but you believe that you can still bring value to the role, we’d love to see your application!

Who We Are:

Criteo is the global commerce media company that enables marketers and media owners to deliver richer consumer experiences and drive better commerce outcomes through its industry leading Commerce Media Platform.

At Criteo, our culture is as unique as it is diverse. From our offices around the world or from home, our incredible team of 3,600 Criteos collaborates to develop an open and inclusive environment. We seek to ensure that all of our workers are treated equally, and we do not tolerate discrimination based on race, gender identity, gender, sexual orientation, color, national origin, religion, age, disability, political opinion, pregnancy, migrant status, ethnicity, marital or family status, or other protected characteristics at all stages of the employment lifecycle including how we attract and recruit, through promotions, pay decisions, benefits, career progression and development. We aim to ensure employment decisions and actions are based solely on business-related considerations and not on protected characteristics. As outlined in our Code of Business Conduct and Ethics, we strictly forbid any kind of discrimination, harassment, mistreatment or bullying towards colleagues, clients, suppliers, stakeholders, shareholders, or any visitors of Criteo. All of this supports us in our mission to power the world’s marketers with trusted and impactful advertising encouraging discovery, innovation and choice in an open internet.

Why Join Us:

At Criteo, we take pride in being a caring culture and are committed to providing our employees with valuable benefits that support their physical, emotional and financial wellbeing, their interests and the important life events. We aim to create a place where people can grow and learn from each other while having a meaningful impact. We want to set you up for success in your job, and an important part of that includes comprehensive perks & benefits. Benefits may vary depending on the country where you work and the nature of your employment with Criteo. When determining compensation, we carefully consider a wide range of job-related factors, including experience, knowledge, skills, education, and location. These factors can cause your compensation to vary.

Title: Marketing Data Analyst (Executive)
Description:
Marketing Data Analyst (Executive)







Dorna Sports is an international sports management, marketing and media company, which manages numerous World Championships in Motorcycle Racing. With a dynamic and fast-paced environment, Dorna Sports focuses on teamwork, stability and performance, and this role will also let you experience the true nature of Motorsports!







Main responsibilities







As a member of the Business Intelligence team, your main responsibilities will be collecting the data from different sources, analyzing the metrics and prepare comprehensive data reports.







Social Media Analytics




Track detailed performance/KPIs and deliver regular data-driven actionable insights to improve results

Benchmark reports: Analyze market dynamics, trends, positioning of Dorna’s championships and other relevant competitions in terms of Social Media/ Digital




Digital products insights




Transform the data/reports from Digital Products team to company insights available for all the company




Fan centric insights




Identification and description of our fan

Work cross-functionally with our Fan Experience team to provide them with insights







Candidate basics







Previous experience in Digital Analytics
University degree in Business Administration, Economics, Marketing or any related field
Fluent level of English and Spanish.
Intermediate to Advanced Microsoft Excel and Power Point proficiency is required to complete basics expectations of this role.
Experience with Sharepoint
Proficiency in data visualization tools (Data Studio, Power BI…)







Skills







Can learn "on the job" independently.
Committed team player
Excellent Analytical skills
Data-driven and agile marketing mindset
Attention to detail
Presentation and written communication skills.







Dorna is an inclusive company and guarantees respect for the diversity of its employees. The company does not discriminate due to gender, age, race, culture, physical ability, or any other reason. Candidates will never be eliminated from consideration due to any of those stated factors.

Title: Associate Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
At Beyond, we power the business of Short Term Rentals through our cutting-edge, full-stack Revenue Management System. Venture-backed, we pioneered this space and have grown to be the globally dominant leader - obsessed with delivering value and performance to our customers. And the way we've been able to achieve those heights is our belief that People are the most important part of any business - starting with ours. We employ over 170 Beyonders across the globe who share in our commitment to making Beyond the best place to work.

It's with that in mind that Beyond is looking to add an Associate Business Intelligence Analyst. Reporting to our Director, Revenue Operations, you will play a critical role in delivering actionable and meaningful metrics to both internal and external stakeholders. Your primary objective will be to provide comprehensive insights that enable our internal teams to gain a holistic understanding of how our products and services connect with each other, and with our customers.

To excel in this position, you should possess a strong technical background and a proven track record in developing reporting, business intelligence, and data solutions. We're looking for someone hands-on, results-oriented, and eager to work cross-functionally.

Before reading further…

Beyond is passionate about diversity and cultivating our team's potential. If you're hungry for a good opportunity, but don't meet every point in this job description, please apply anyway!

As our Associate Business Intelligence Analyst, you'll be responsible for:


Data, Data, & more Data - Analyze & optimize our current data transformation pipelines. Create new data models to support business insights & monitor data quality.
Technical Partnership - Partner closely with other Tech, Product and Data engineering teams on the day-to-day execution of analytics, projects & new data initiatives.
Harvesting insights - Enabling effective decision-making by retrieving and aggregating data from multiple sources and compiling it into a digestible and actionable format.
Business Expertise - Leveraging a deep, data-driven understanding of the key drivers and metrics underpinning Beyond's products and business lines to draw insights and make recommendations that will help the company grow and scale effectively.
Showing the way to key stakeholders - Conduct deep-dive analysis with complex SQL queries and translate requirements into effective & innovative data visualizations and solutions in Mode. Partnering closely with our GTM, Finance & Product teams to support their business objectives through analysis.


So what kind of person are we looking for in this role? The person who will be successful in this role will be an:


Innovator - Insights without action are lost opportunities and you regularly seek new information, try new approaches, and want to increase the pace of learning
Storyteller - You love telling stories with data, and have a playbook for how to bring people along in the process
Explorer - You seek information that challenges assumptions and delight in finding insights that are not obvious.
Advisor - You have the ability to distill and share key data and insights that lead to better decision-making and strategy


Now that we've told you what the job looks like, here are the qualifications we're looking for in a candidate:


2+ years of experience working in a Business Intelligence / Analytics environment.
Strong data modeling & proficiency SQL skills with experience working with complex & large data sets.
Experience harnessing data from multiple sources and making it usable and accessible for non-technical users.
Hands-on experience with data transformation tools, query engines and data visualization tools (dbt, airflow & Mode are what we use)
Experience articulating business questions, and using available data to find answers that translate into business recommendations.
You have exceptional business intuition and conceptual thinking, with the ability to readily map business processes to the appropriate metrics.
Experience with dbt / Python is a plus


So what can you expect after you apply? Your application will be personally reviewed by a member of the Beyond hiring team and if there is a match in your experience and the role, you will:


Have a video conversation with someone on our Recruiting team. This is a high-level conversation about your experience and interest, but also an opportunity for you to learn more about us
Interview with our Director, Revenue Operations & BI
Complete a technical assignment
Meet with our team for deeper dive video conversations
Interview with our Chief Revenue Officer
Interview with our Chief Technology Officer/Cofounder


Company Values:

We are serious about our core values: We Care, We Are On the Same Team, We Inspire Trust, We Go Beyond, We Ship It, We're Curious. If those resonate with you, and you're ready to work with a team that lives and breathes those values, we want to hear from you.

Benefits:

Beyond offers a wide variety of benefits like: stock options, unlimited PTO, private health insurance and more! You can learn more about our benefits by visiting our careers site!

We Care about Diversity, Equity and Inclusion:

Beyond is committed to building a workplace that attracts humans of all genders, ethnicities, backgrounds, statuses and lifestyles. At our core, we care about our people and encourage every employee, partner and applicant to share their whole self with us. We are respectful of and empathetic towards different viewpoints, and believe that our ability to help short term rental managers succeed relies on us building a dynamic and diverse team. Whoever you are, you can Belong @ Beyond.

Any communication regarding job openings, interviews and/or offers will come from our @beyondpricing.com email domain

Please review our GDPR Statement here.

Description:

As a member of our Performance Media Analytics team, you won't just analyse data; you'll be the cornerstone that connects groundbreaking ideas with real-world business applications. Here, your expertise will not only shape solutions but also empower our clients and commercial teams to make impactful decisions:


Client insights: you will analyze complex data from multiple sources to understand the performance of our advertisers campaigns and generate innovative and impactful insights
Data-Driven Innovation: Leverage cutting-edge tech like Hadoop, Vertica, Tableau, Python, and SQL to transform complex business challenges into groundbreaking solutions.
Reporting tools and metrics: you will develop and scale reports and metrics that will present actionable insights to teams across the business and strategic leadership teams
Tech Playground: Immerse yourself in an environment where experimenting with advanced analytics tools isn't just encouraged, it's part of your daily work.
Collaborative projects: you will work on ad hoc projects with different teams to automate analyses globally, improve our internal processes and our way of working and scale knowledge across the company.



Your Work Environment:


Flexible remote working options - balance your life the way you want.
A tech-forward, primarily digital workspace.
Need special work hours? Let's talk about it!



Who You Are:


A problem-solver with a passion for analytics and a logical approach to challenges.
Interested in solving data problems using Python & SQL, and enthusiastic about automating and scaling solutions.
Business-minded with a goal to turn data insights into actionable strategies.
Team player who thrives in a collaborative, inclusive, and vibrant workspace.
Fluent in English and skilled at simplifying complex concepts for diverse audiences.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About The Company

Shalion is a data-driven company working for world-class manufacturers and brands worldwide. With its Digital Shelf Optimization and Retail Media solutions, Shalion provides innovative tools that facilitate e-commerce monitoring.

We, at Shalion, enable brands to make smarter business decisions in eCommerce, based on actionable data and insights providing information on online product prices, availability, share of search, etc. in more than 800 e-retailers and 50 different countries. Our client portfolio includes industry giants such as Heineken, Lego, Danone, and Nestlé.

The role

As a Data Analyst at Shalion, your responsibilities include:


Developing and maintaining client and internal dashboards in Looker.
Collaborating with Product teams to shape the product roadmap based on customer feedback and market insights.
Translating business requirements into technical tasks, ensuring timely delivery.
Working closely with Data Engineers to expand and enhance datasets, contributing to roadmap planning.
Ensuring data quality and consistency across dashboards.
Translating product questions into actionable insights.
Support the team in solving problems and challenges related to reporting and information analysis to create best practices in data usage and consumption.


Your profile should include the following:


2+ years of experience working as a data analyst or visualization expert.
Hands-on and strong working knowledge of SQL.
High experience level with modern visualization tools such as Looker, Tableau, Qlik Sense, or Power BI.
Solid statistical background.
Experience working with business stakeholders and engineers.
Experience in data modeling for visualization.
Communication, teamwork, and problem-solving skills.
Ability to structure information, analyze it, and extract data according to business needs


Ideally you will also have:


An advanced degree in a quantitative field such as math, physics, computer science, statistics, etc.
Experience with market research analysis.
Experience working with a modern cloud data warehouse (Redshift, Snowflake, BigQuery, or similar).
Knowledge of Git and command-line
Prior experience modeling data in LookML and dbt (data build tool)
Be fluent with one or more common data-related programming languages (Python or R).
UX skills.


Soft Skills:


Prioritization: Skillful at prioritizing tasks, gaining stakeholder buy-in, and resolving conflicts.
Resilience: Able to thrive in ambiguous situations and enjoy problem-solving.
Curiosity: Eagerness to learn and engage in constructive discussions.
Quality-oriented: Can discern data quality and value code testing for growth.


What We Offer You


The possibility to contribute to developing a company-wide data direction, processes, and standards.
Hybrid work: one remote day and four days of in-office work to boost our productivity and promote a work-life balance.
To be part of a high-performing team in a fast-paced, innovative environment.
Talented, diverse, and very friendly work environment;
The fast-growing project, where you can grow and develop
A challenging project, where you can have great contributions and impact
International environment with more than 10 nationalities
Fresh fruit every day
Office with a good location in Barcelona (Sarrià- Sant Gervasi).
Fixed-term contract.


Interview process


First interview HR screening
Second interview SQL assignment
Third interview CDO

What We Offer You

  • The possibility to contribute to developing a company-wide data direction, processes, and standards.
  • Hybrid work: one remote day and four days of in-office work to boost our productivity and promote a work-life balance.
  • To be part of a high-performing team in a fast-paced, innovative environment.
  • Talented, diverse, and very friendly work environment;
  • The fast-growing project, where you can grow and develop
  • A challenging project, where you can have great contributions and impact
  • International environment with more than 10 nationalities
  • Fresh fruit every day
  • Office with a good location in Barcelona (Sarrià- Sant Gervasi).
  • Fixed-term contract.

Interview process

  • First interview HR screening
  • Second interview SQL assignment
  • Third interview CDO

Title: Finance Data Analyst - (100% remote-friendly within Spain)
Description:
We are the largest digital healthcare platform in the world, present in 15 countries and currently connecting over 30 million patients to more than 2 million healthcare professionals. We seek to make the experience in health more human and we live and breath this mission.


We obsess over the challenge of minimizing patients' pain and helping healthcare professionals thrive managing their patients and expand their online presence. Through services that bring health to users, we provide a space for questions, opinions and a way to find the health professional that best fits your needs.


To deliver the best result, we have motivated people with an innovative spirit, giving everyone the opportunity to actively contribute and grow within the company. The DocPlanner team is our secret sauce and for the 2nd consecutive year we were recognized as a Great Place To Work. We love diversity because each unique individual's perspective makes us stronger. We encourage everyone to participate in our hiring process. We’d love for you to bring your unique skill set and join the team!




Job Description



The resource, working within the Financial Reporting team, will play a key role in supporting the evolution of financial reporting in a challenging and stimulating environment. You will help bridge the gap between finance and BI. Our primary objective is to assist the business in making decisions based on data, with a particular emphasis on producing reports as the primary and most reliable source of information.


A team of 12 experts provides support to various departments, including marketing, sales, customer success, finance, and people experience, for both short-term and long-term projects. Collaborating closely with stakeholders, we strive to develop reports, analyses, models, and recommendations that enable us to gain a deep understanding of how we can enhance the satisfaction of both doctors and patients.


You will be an integral part of the Financial Reporting team, working closely with the Data Analytics team to support business decisions based on data.

How would you be impacting our mission


Financial Reporting and Analysis:
Track key financial metrics and KPIs, ensuring they align with organizational goals;
Develop and maintain comprehensive financial dashboards using advanced BI tools;
Provide detailed insights into financial performance, trends, and variances;
Provide insights for long-term strategic decisions;
Data Management and Integration:
Ensure accurate and timely collection of financial data from systems like Oracle NetSuite;
Integrate data from multiple sources for a unified financial view;
Performance Measurement:
Analyze profitability and cost efficiency to identify improvement areas;
Regulatory and Compliance Reporting:
Support audits and for regulatory documentation;
Automation and Process Improvement:
Automate repetitive financial tasks to improve efficiency;
Implement process improvements to reduce manual efforts and errors;
Enhanced Reporting and Visualization:
Utilize BI tools like Tableau for dynamic, interactive reports and dashboards;
Enhance report quality and accessibility beyond traditional spreadsheets.


Qualifications



What will help you thrive?


Bachelor's degree in Economics, Statistics, Econometrics or a related field.
Demonstrable experience in using SQL to derive actionable insights, either in commercial or academic setting (must have).
Knowledge of Python/R and desire to expand your knowledge.
Experience with statistical modeling and descriptive statistics.
Experience in partnership with internal stakeholders.
Experience in leading and executing end to end BI projects.
Strong written and oral communication skills in English; proficiency in other languages such as German, Spanish, and Italian is a plus.
Ability to gather, organize, analyze, and report large volumes of financial data with speed and accuracy.
Strong attention to detail with the ability to provide high-quality work efficiently.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Ability to adapt and work in a quickly changing environment, managing competing demands.

Which skills are ‘bonus points’?


Master's degree in Economics, Statistics, Econometrics or a related field.
Able to take a step back from the technicalities and examine them through a business lens.
Open to cooperating with a lot of people from many teams in different countries.
Like to see the instant effects of your work.
Knowledge of ERP finance applications (Oracle, Oracle - NetSuite, SAP).
Relevant experience in accounting and financial reporting.


Additional Information



What will you get in return?


Let’s talk money


Flexible remuneration and benefits system via Flexoh, which includes: restaurant card, transportation card, kindergarten, and training tax savings;
Share options plan after 6 months of working with us

True flexibility and work-life balance


Remote first in one of our legal entities or hybrid work model in one of our office locations;
Flexible working hours;
Paid time off according to your location of work;
Additional paid holiday on your birthday or work anniversary (you choose what you want to celebrate).

Health comes first


Health insurance according to your location of work:
Access to iFeel, a technological platform for mental wellness offering online psychological support and counseling.

What does the recruitment process look like?


A 30-minute meeting with Ro - Head of International Talent Acquisition
SHL test
A 45-minute meeting with Nicolò Truffa - Head of Financial reporting
A 60-minute meeting Wiktor Kulikowski - Business Intelligence Manager including the live SQL testing
Business Case - Prepare a Business Case
Present it within the with Nico and Wiktor for 90 minutes
Meet the Team for 15 minute meeting

Please submit your CV exclusively in English.


We promote and embrace equal opportunities in our hiring process, and also every day at work. When you apply for our roles you receive equal treatment regardless of age, disabilities, gender reassignment, marital or civil partner status, pregnancy or parental status, race, colour, nationality, ethnic or national origin, religion or belief, sex, sexual orientation or any other dimension of human difference. If you require additional support in your recruitment process, we kindly encourage you to let us know. Behind those words you’re reading, there’s a person (hi!) who already helped a candidate by adapting the interviews, and now we’re lucky to have this person with us. So, even if you’ve never asked for it before, may this serve as a sign that, now, you can do so. We can only truly be equal if we adapt to each other.


“We believe all humans, in all their beautiful diversity, should have equal rights, dignity and respect. Period.” Mariusz Gralewski, CEO

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst (100% remote in Poland or Spain)
Description:
Welcome to the good side of tech 👋


You might have heard about us, but with a different name: Doctoralia. It all started 10 years ago, when we asked ourselves: is anyone in healthcare thinking about patients? We jumped in and we empowered patients by giving them access to leave and read reviews about their visit. We then provided doctors with the technology to manage bookings easily and save time, so they could devote themselves to what they always wanted: treating patients. And today is the day in which we ask you: will you join us in the next step of making the healthcare experience more human?


Docplanner at scale


We are leaders in 13 countries so far, and more than 90 million patients trust us every month. Almost 300.000 specialists believe in us and our product, and so do leading venture capital funds such as Point Nine Capital, Goldman Sachs Asset Management and One Peak Partners. And yet, employing over 2.700 people all over the globe, we managed to keep the startup-mindset we started with over 10 years ago.




Job Description



Our primary objective is to assist business in making decisions based on data, with a particular emphasis on producing global reports as the primary and most reliable source of information. A team of 12 experts provides support to various departments, including marketing, sales, customer success, finance, and people experience, for both short-term and long-term projects. Collaborating closely with stakeholders, we strive to develop reports, analyses, models, and recommendations that enable us to gain a deep understanding of how we can enhance the satisfaction of both doctors and patients.


How would you be impacting our mission?


Derive facts from data and translate them into actionable insights and recommendations.
Support the business with identifying opportunities and making intelligent, data-driven decisions. You will execute end-to-end BI projects and be the main point of contact for the internal stakeholders.
Use (and develop!) a global database.
Create, automate and visualize reports and analysis for both top management and local teams (such as Finance, Sales, Customer Success, Marketing, Customer Experience).
When you become independent in the role you will have a chance to develop prediction/classification models using Python/R.
Work with Redshift, Git, Tableau, Airflow daily.



Qualifications



What will help you thrive?


Demonstrable experience in using SQL to derive actionable insights, either in commercial or academic setting (must have).
Knowledge of Python/R and desire to expand your knowledge.
Experience with statistical modeling and descriptive statistics.
Experience in partnership with internal stakeholders.
Experience in leading and executing end to end BI projects.
Very good level of business English.

Which skills are ‘bonus points’?


Have a degree in Economics, Statistics, Econometrics or a related field.
Are able to take a step back from the technicalities and examine them through a business lens.
Are open to cooperating with a lot of people from many teams in different countries.
Like to see instant effects of your work.
Are careful, diligent and detail-oriented.



Additional Information



What will you get in return?


Let’s talk money


Flexible remuneration and benefits system via Flexoh, which includes: restaurant card, transportation card, kindergarten, and training tax savings;
Share options plan after 6 months of working with us.

True flexibility and work-life balance


Remote first in one of our legal entities or hybrid work model in one of our office locations;
Flexible working hours;
Paid time off according to your location of work;
Additional paid holiday on your birthday or work anniversary (you choose what you want to celebrate).

Health comes first


Health insurance according to your location of work;
Access to iFeel, a technological platform for mental wellness offering online psychological support and counseling.

What does the recruitment process look like?


A 30-minute meeting with Rosario Corti - Head of International Talent Acquisition
A 60-minute meeting with Wiktor Kulikowski - BI Manager
Business Case - Prepare a Business Case and present it within the final chat (60 minutes) with Wiktor

We promote and embrace equal opportunities in our hiring process, and also every day at work. When you apply for our roles you receive equal treatment regardless of age, disabilities, gender reassignment, marital or civil partner status, pregnancy or parental status, race, color, nationality, ethnic or national origin, religion or belief, sex, sexual orientation or any other dimension of human difference. If you require additional support in your recruitment process, we kindly encourage you to let us know. “We believe all humans, in all their beautiful diversity, should have equal rights, dignity and respect. Period.” Mariusz Gralewski, CEO

Title: Data Analyst II (They/She/He)
Description:
If you’re here, it’s because you’re looking for an exciting ride.

A ride that will fuel up your ambitions to take on a new challenge and stretch yourself beyond your comfort zone.

We’ll deliver a non-vanilla culture built on talent, where we work to amplify the impact on millions of people, paving the way forward together.

Not your usual app. We are the fastest-growing multi-category app connecting millions of users with businesses, and couriers, offering on-demand services from more than 170,000 local restaurants, grocers and supermarkets, and high street retail stores. We operate in more than 1500 cities across 25 countries.

Together we revolutionize the way people connect with their everyday needs, from delivering essentials to connecting our ecosystem of users through innovative solutions powered by technology. For us, every day is filled with purpose.

What makes our ride unique?

🤝 Our culture and strong values.

💪 Our career development philosophy.

🤝 Our commitment to being a force for good.

We have a vision: To give everyone easy access to anything in their cities. And this is where your ride starts.

YOUR MISSION

Join our team and become an integral part of Glovo's Global Operations! We provide a dynamic and challenging environment filled with numerous opportunities for growth and development.

Couriers are the cornerstone of Glovo’s marketplace. We are seeking a Data Analyst who can strike the perfect balance between creativity and data-driven precision, turning seemingly impossible projects into reality.

In this role, you will be responsible for delivering insights and data to drive the core strategies of the Courier Supply Excellence team. By leveraging analytics, you will globally identify methods to enhance courier engagement at the order, hourly, and monthly levels. The KPIs you will influence are crucial to operations, as every decision made will directly affect the whole operational investment.

THE JOURNEY


Bring your boldest ideas to life and make an immediate global impact.
Understand and address local and regional needs by stepping into the shoes of the couriers and truly understanding their perspective.
Continuously explore and refine key operational metrics (delivery time, efficiency, costs), gaining a comprehensive understanding of Glovo’s operations.
Offer analytical support to teams across more than 20 countries by deepening the understanding of Glovo's operational model.
Enhance the strategies we use to define each market’s approach.
Manage dashboards and create new tools to improve the department’s metric visibility.
Develop analytical frameworks and models, while effectively communicating with the entire department.
Dive deep into data to identify key factors and actions to improve KPIs, taking accountability for outcomes.
Innovate to contribute to the ongoing improvement of courier profitability.


What You Will Bring To The Ride


Degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Math, Statistics or similar
+2 years of work experience providing internal teams with the necessary data to make the right decisions, banking / financial background is a plus
Strong analytical and coding skills: SQL and Excel proficiency (or extensive coding experience), and BI platforms experience (Looker, Tableau, PowerBI,…)
Python and experience working with analysis tools such as Pandas, SciPy, Scikit, Jupyter/iPython notebooks, R is highly valued
Strong strategic vision and business mindset
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills
Comfortable working in high-growth and high-performance start-ups with a fast-paced
Professional English


Individuals representing diverse profiles, and abilities, encompassing various genders, ethnicities, and backgrounds, are less likely to apply for this role if they do not possess solid experience in 100% of these areas. Even if it seems you don't meet our musts don't let it stop you, we are all about finding the best talent out there! Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable.

We Believe Driven Talent Deserves


🌟 An enticing equity plan that lets you own a piece of the action.
💪 Top-notch private health insurance to keep you at your peak.
🍔 Monthly Glovo credit to satisfy your cravings!
💳 Cobee discounts on transportation, food, and even kindergarten expenses.
🏊 Discounted gym memberships to keep you energized.
🏖️ Extra time off, the freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year!
👪 Enhanced parental leave, and office-based nursery.
🧠 Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being.


Here at Glovo, we thrive on diversity, we believe it enhances our teams, products, and culture. We know that the best ideas come from a mashup of brilliant diverse minds. This is why we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds - all genders, racial/diverse backgrounds, abilities, ages, sexual orientations and all other unique characteristics that make you YOU. We will encourage you to bring your authentic self to work, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels heard.

Feel free to note your pronouns in your application (e.g., she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

So, ready to take the wheel and make this the ride of your life?

Delve into our culture by taking a peek at our Instagram and check out our Linkedin and website!

Delve into our culture by taking a peek at our Instagram and check out our Linkedin and website!

Title: Digital Data Analyst
Description:
Somos DDB, somos creadores de ideas.

Ayudamos a nuestros clientes a ser líderes.

Trabajamos con ellos como socios estratégicos.

Nos sumergimos en el negocio de nuestros clientes y buscamos soluciones creativas.

Iniciamos y mantenemos vivo el diálogo de las marcas con el consumidor.

Creamos ideas con trascendencia social porque sólo así tendremos relevancia.

Perfil

En DDB buscamos un/a Data Analyst para que forme parte de nuestro equipo en la oficina de Barcelona.

Responsabilidades


Exploración de datos y creación de informes
Análisis web y entorno digital
Visualización de datos y dashboards en:
Adobe Analytics
Google Analytics y Data Studio
Otros
Estudios de consumidores, comportamiento digital, journey de usuarios, navegación y usabilidad
Segmentación y perfilado de usuarios/consumidores
Búsqueda de data para obtención de insights y generación de recomendaciones
Marketing digital para industria automoción

Requisitos


Performance de campañas Paid (especialmente SEM/Display/Programática)
Análisis de performance en social media.
Estrategia SEO
Set up/mantenimiento de Google Tag Manager
Modelos de atribución y fases de funnel
CRM
Definición de KPIs y métricas relevantes
Conocimiento entornos digitales, especialmente web
Orientación a obtención de insights estratégicos
Habilidades de presentación y comunicación


Todas las candidaturas serán consideradas para el empleo, independientemente de su raza, orientación sexual o edad.

¿Qué ofrecemos?

Modelo de trabajo híbrido: días presenciales en la oficina combinados con días de teletrabajo.

Ambiente de trabajo creativo y dinámico donde podrás desarrollar todo tu talento y podrás crecer personal y profesionalmente.

Nuestro programa DDB Concilia, con beneficios exclusivos por pertenecer a DDB, además de programas de bienestar emocional con servicios personalizados.

Todo esto y mucho más. ¿Te vienes?

Tu información personal se utilizará de acuerdo con nuestro Aviso de Privacidad. Puedes leer nuestro Aviso de Privacidad aquí cuando presentes tu solicitud.

Title: Data Analyst (Retention Analytics Team)
Description:
Job Description

Hi there!

We are Semrush, a global IT company developing our own product – a platform for digital marketers. New stars are born here, so don’t miss your chance. This is our Data Analyst role for those who strive to implement functional processes and drive them to full completion.

We are seeking a Data Analyst with a h2 focus on Data Analysis and Business Intelligence (BI) to join our Retention division. The ideal candidate will support the development, implementation, and deployment of analytics on customer and product data, delivering actionable insights to drive business decisions. A basic understanding of Data Science principles will be beneficial in enhancing the analytical capabilities of our team.

Tasks in the role


Data Analysis & Reporting:
Conduct in-depth analysis of product insights and customer behavior to identify data-driven opportunities for improving customer retention and fostering profitable growth.
Analyze and report on data patterns and customer pain points using various data sources, including structured and unstructured data, benchmarks, and operational metrics.
Create meaningful reports and insights to support hypotheses, driving testing and experimentation.
Provide ad-hoc analysis and reporting to meet the evolving needs of the Retention division.

Business Intelligence:
Design and develop dashboards and reports in BI tools like Tableau or PowerBI, ensuring they are user-friendly and aligned with UI/UX best practices.
Create and maintain reporting specifications for new reports/dashboards and perform testing/validation to ensure data integrity, accessibility, and accuracy.
Consult with Retention division staff to identify new business reporting needs and provide guidance on complex data environments.

Data Systems & Documentation:
Document data analysis efforts, including data sources, reporting specifications, and issue/problem resolutions.
Ensure proper documentation of reporting and analytical tools for future reference and continuity.



Requirements

Who we are looking for

Technical Skills:


Strong experience in SQL and database design.
Proficiency in designing dashboards and reports in BI tools such as Tableau or PowerBI.
Basic knowledge of data science principles, with the ability to apply them to drive actionable insights.
Experience with cloud platforms and cloud storage solutions is a plus.
Understanding of data extraction using API calls.
Professional Skills:
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to present complex data clearly and concisely.
Strong analytical skills, with the ability to interpret data and make data-driven decisions.
Ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams and stakeholders.



Not required, but a plus


2+ years of experience in data analysis, business intelligence, or a related field
Familiarity with cloud platforms, particularly GCP, is an advantage
Basic programming skills in Python or R for data manipulation and analysis
You share our common values: Trust, because we prefer to speak up and be our true selves; Sense of Ownership, because it’s not worth wasting time on something you don’t believe in; and enthusiasm for Constant Changes, because we are always looking to make things better



A Bit About The Team

You can get to know the team better at one of the interviews, but some brief information about future colleagues will be useful now.

Our team is a dynamic mix of analysts and engineers who collaborate on a wide range of analytics projects, including data analysis, dashboard development, model building, and A/B testing across various domains. We work closely with the Retention division, delivering actionable insights and helping to drive data-driven decisions. What sets us apart is our chill, supportive vibe and a deep belief in success through collaboration. We prioritize teamwork, knowledge sharing, and continuous learning. Everyone’s contributions are valued, and we work together to solve complex problems while keeping the atmosphere positive and fun. If you enjoy a collaborative environment where innovation is encouraged and teamwork drives success, you’ll fit right in!

We will try to create all the right conditions for you to work and rest comfortably


This offer stands for the “hybrid” work format: some days, you work from the office, and some #wfh. Trust us, it’s an efficient way of work. Proven!
Flexible working day start
Unlimited PTO
Hobby benefit
Breakfast, snacks, and coffee at the office
Corporate events
Training, courses, conferences
Gifts for employees



Finally, a Little More About Our Company

Semrush is a leading online visibility management SaaS platform that enables businesses globally to run search engine optimization, pay-per-click, content, social media and competitive research campaigns and get measurable results from online marketing.

We’ve been developing our product for 16 years and have been awarded G2s Top 100 Software Products, Global and US Search Awards 2021, Great Place to Work Certification, Deloitte Technology Fast 500 and many more. In March 2021 Semrush went public and started trading on the NYSE with the SEMR ticker.

10,000,000+ users in America, Europe, Asia, and Australia have already tried Semrush, and over 1,000 people around the world are working on its development. The Semrush team is constantly growing.

Semrush is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, creed, color, national origin, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, ancestry, physical or mental disability, or medical condition including medical characteristics, genetic identity, marital status, military service, or any other classification protected by applicable local, state or federal laws. All employment decisions are based on business needs, job requirements, merit, and individual qualifications.

10,000,000+ users in America, Europe, Asia, and Australia have already tried Semrush, and over 1,000 people around the world are working on its development. The Semrush team is constantly growing.

Semrush is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. Title: Controller Financiero/a y Analista de Datos
Description:
El/La candidato/a se responsabilizará de la preparación de informes financieros, la gestión de presupuestos y la implementación de controles internos para asegurar la precisión y la integridad de la información financiera. El/la controller financiero trabaja estrechamente con la alta dirección para apoyar la toma de decisiones estratégicas y garantizar la estabilidad financiera de la organización.




Responsabilidades Principales:




Planificación Financiera y Presupuestaria:




Realizar análisis de variaciones presupuestarias y proponer acciones correctivas.




Informes Financieros:




Preparar estados financieros mensuales, trimestrales y anuales.
Análisis de les diferencies en los reportings financieros, explicación y plan de acción y seguimiento del mismo.




Análisis Financiero:




Realizar análisis financieros detallados para apoyar la toma de decisiones.
Evaluar la rentabilidad de proyectos y propuestas de inversión.
Identificar y analizar tendencias financieras, riesgos y oportunidades.




Control Interno y Cumplimiento:




Implementar y mantener sistemas de control interno efectivos.
Asegurar el cumplimiento de políticas financieras internas y regulaciones externas.
Participar en auditorías internas y externas, y gestionar la implementación de recomendaciones.




Requisitos del Puesto:




Formación:




Título universitario en Contabilidad, Finanzas, Economía o campos relacionados.
Deseable un máster en Finanzas, MBA o certificaciones profesionales.
Conocimientos en automatización de procesos financieros utilizando scripts de Python.
Excel avanzado, incluyendo el uso tablas dinámicas y modelado financiero complejo (uso de Power Query valorado).







Experiencia:




Mínimo de 5 a 7 años de experiencia en roles financieros, preferiblemente en control financiero o auditoría.
Experiencia en el manejo y análisis de grandes volúmenes de datos mediante el uso de bases de datos (Access, SQL, u otros sistemas relacionados).
Experiencia en la integración de sistemas ERP con herramientas de análisis de datos para mejorar la eficiencia y precisión de los reportes financieros.







Conocimientos y Habilidades Técnicas:




Experiencia en el manejo y análisis de grandes volúmenes de datos mediante el uso de bases de datos (Access, SQL, u otros sistemas relacionados).
Conocimientos en automatización de procesos financieros utilizando scripts de Python.
Excel avanzado, incluyendo el uso tablas dinámicas y modelado financiero complejo (uso de Power Query valorado).
Familiaridad con herramientas de visualización de datos como Power BI o similares.
Experiencia en la integración de sistemas ERP con herramientas de análisis de datos para mejorar la eficiencia y precisión de los reportes financieros.
Capacidad para desarrollar y optimizar procesos automatizados que reduzcan errores y mejoren la eficiencia en la elaboración de informes financieros.
Orientación a la innovación tecnológica y mejora continua en el ámbito financiero.
Conocimiento profundo de principios contables y normativas fiscales.
Dominio de software financiero y de contabilidad puesto que se trabaja con gran volumen de datos. (ERP, Excel, etc.).
Nivel de ingles medio-alto (ser capaz de hacer reportings en inglés de y de explicarlos)
Capacidad para trabajar bajo presión y cumplir con plazos estrictos.
Acostumbrado/a a trabajar con varios departamentos. el candidato/a estará en estrecha colaboración con el controllers industrial y con el director financiero.
Deseable conocimientos de controlling industrial e involucración en el departamento administrativo financiero.




Competencias:




Pensamiento analítico y estratégico.
Orientación a resultados y atención al detalle.
Habilidad para resolver problemas y tomar decisiones.
Integridad y ética profesional.
Trabajo en equipo

Title: Data Analyst sector Automoción
Description:
CT es una empresa líder en tecnología, que proporciona servicios de innovación e ingeniería en los sectores aeronáutico, espacial, naval, automovilístico, ferroviario, energético y de plantas industriales. CT impulsa los límites de la tecnología a través de la innovación, y lleva la eficiencia a otro nivel cubriendo todo el ciclo de vida de los productos, desde el diseño y la fabricación hasta el soporte postventa. Con más de 30 años de experiencia, el éxito de CT está impulsado hoy en día por más de 1.800 ingenieros expertos repartidos en siete países, en tres continentes.

Actualmente Estamos Buscando Incorporar Ingeniero/as De Datos Para Diferentes Proyectos De Automoción En Las Empresas Más Importantes Del Sector En Barcelona, Para La Realización De Las Siguientes Tareas


Analizar datos de producción, calidad y rendimiento de vehículos para identificar mejoras operativas y optimizar procesos.
Crear informes y dashboards visuales para comunicar insights a equipos de ingeniería, manufactura y dirección.
Colaborar con diferentes departamentos para implementar soluciones basadas en datos que mejoren la eficiencia y la calidad del producto.
Formación en Ingeneria
Experiencia previa en automoción
Valorable experiencia en departamentos de I+D o departamento de test/validaciones.
Nivel de Ingés alto
Conocimientos en lenguajes de programación
Manejo de bases de datos
Conocimientos de IA, IoT y Big Data


¿Qué ofrecemos?


Modalidad de trabajo híbrida (3 días presenciales y 2 días de teletrabajo).
Horario de 08h a 17:30h, viernes media jornada.
Desarrollo profesional continuo.
Retribución competitiva.
Clima laboral participativo, inclusivo y dinámico. ¡Nos encanta trabajar en equipo!
Formar parte del lugar donde los ingenieros aman trabajar.


Buscamos una persona proactiva, motivada, con ganas de seguir creciendo en el mundo industrial, con ganas de nuevos retos dentro del mundo tecnológico.

Si te sientes identificado no dudes en aplicar!

Title: Data Specialist (Intern)
Description:
Job Description

This is a remote position.

Are you a trailblazer looking for a new challenge in a pioneering organization with global impact? Are you looking to boost your professional growth, being part of an emerging company? Then Eticas is for you!

At Eticas, we are global leaders in Responsible and Fair AI on a mission to protect people in technology processes. Over the last decade, we have developed cutting-edge methodologies and tools to identify and mitigate bias, promote fairness, and ensure AI and ML algorithms obtain more accurate results.

With our flagship AI Auditing product, ITACA, Eticas is at a crucial point in its history, and we need a winning team to execute this plan and assert ourselves as pioneers in deploying commercial auditing solutions.

What will your role look like?

As a Data Specialist Intern, you will support our AI auditing team performing sociotechnical analysis, reviewing and analyzing data, coding and contributing to the creation of audit reports, publications, and other audit-related content.

This internship provides a unique opportunity to collaborate with a diverse and motivated team and help shape a more ethical future in technology.

Your Key Responsibilities

Participate in building the scientific underpinnings of our groundbreaking tools to measure, monitor, and mitigate bias in AI.

Participate in the implementation of quantitative methods, including data collection, coding, developing metrics, and analysis of results.

Support our audits using both statistical tools and qualitative analysis methods to perform sociotechnical analysis which are applicable in real life.

Collaborate with team members to develop the existing products and create new ones based on the needs of the clients and market demand.

Managing project documentation and communicating with stakeholders and clients.

Stay updated on the latest developments in AI auditing and research to inform project activities.

Requirements

Must-have skills:

Fluency in English, both written and spoken.

Completed or in-progress degree in a relevant field such as social sciences (with a focus on quantitative methods), statistics, data science, computer science, or related disciplines.

Experience in R or similar coding tools (Python).

Solid understanding of statistics and experience with statistical analysis software.

Experience or interest in conducting research related to AI/ML, social media recommender systems, ethical technology, or algorithmic auditing.

Excellent written communication skills and the ability to work collaboratively as well as independently.

Enthusiasm for social change and a commitment to ethical considerations in technology.

Experience working in remote and cloud-based environments.

Experience in working in environments such as Agile, Scrum or similar methodologies.

A lifelong learning attitude.

Benefits

What Eticas can offer you:

We are pioneers of the sector in the world, so our day-to-day is never a routine. We embrace the challenge of learning every day how to improve in our roles and how to add value to others!

We work as a community, learning together from an emerging business. You will always count on us! We are diverse in technical and management profiles, whose motivation and knowledge we learn from every day.

We want to positively impact the world. You will work in a company that wants to generate global change, in pursuit of justice and responsibility.

We believe in independence in carrying out our tasks. We pursue our goals and insist on high standards.

We encourage and embrace diverse backgrounds because we understand the value of diversity to increase our value as a company.

Who will you be collaborating with?

Gemma, Founder and CEO at Eticas

Arancha Cienfuegos, Chief Operations Officer at Eticas

Ariane Aumaitre, Lead Data Scientist at Eticas

If, after everything we have explained, you think you are the best candidate, send an email to ****** with your CV and a cover letter explaining why you are interested in working with us and what you can contribute to Eticas and the above role.

Title: Business Insights Analyst
Description:
If you’re here, it’s because you’re looking for an exciting ride.

A ride that will fuel up your ambitions to take on a new challenge and stretch yourself beyond your comfort zone.

We’ll deliver a non-vanilla culture built on talent, where we work to amplify the impact on millions of people, paving the way forward together.

Not your usual app. We are the fastest-growing multi-category app connecting millions of users with businesses, and couriers, offering on-demand services from more than 170,000 local restaurants, grocers and supermarkets, and high street retail stores. We operate in more than 1500 cities across 25 countries.

Together we revolutionise the way people connect with their everyday needs, from delivering essentials to connecting our ecosystem of users through innovative solutions powered by technology. For us, every day is filled with purpose.

What makes our ride unique?

🤝 Our culture and strong values.

💪 Our career development philosophy.

🤝 Our commitment to being a force for good.

We have a vision: To give everyone easy access to anything in their cities. And this is where your ride starts.

YOUR MISSION

We are looking for a world-class analyst to become part of our SEE (Southeastern Europe) Growth team. Are you able to translate data into actionable insights? Are you looking for a challenging experience in the fast and rapidly changing environment helping to build a product that will disrupt the On-demand market? If your answer is YES and you are eager to join a strongly data-driven and results-focused team we are looking forward to meeting you!

THE JOURNEY


Understand business needs of SEE countries under your scope and create insightful analysis helping your team to make the right decisions to boost Glovo presence and orders.
Identify growth opportunities to increase our user base focusing on traffic, conversion and retention rates and leveraging on levers such as pricing, promotions, events, CRM and other marketing levers etc.
Drive projects end-to-end translating business challenges into insights and actions
Identify growth opportunities to increase our user base, step change retention rates and maximize profitability
Take ownership of the reporting of KPIs by creating customized tools and using the available ones
Ensure these tools are scalable and up-to-date
Assist your colleagues in gaining access to the right data, and Communicate and simplify concepts to the audience's needs
Drive clarity and solve ambiguity using data-driven approaches
Apply your expertise in quantitative analysis, data mining, and the presentation of data to see beyond the numbers and understand how our users interact with both our consumer and business products, identify growth opportunities, and execute on projects to drive growth and engagement


What You Will Bring To The Ride


2-3 years of work experience on analytical roles leading analysis and turning insights into actions
Bachelor's degree in Math, Engineering, Business, Stats or Quantitative field
SQL proficiency is mandatory / Python is a plus
Ninja expertise with Excel / Google Sheets is a must
Knowledge of visualization tools like Tableau, Looker or Qlikview
Business acumen and passion for end-to-end project management (from ideation and analysis into implementation).
Hands-on attitude is a must. You’ll have to roll up your sleeves!
Proficiency in English
Strong consumer understanding skills


Individuals representing diverse profiles, and abilities, encompassing various genders, ethnicities, and backgrounds, are less likely to apply for this role if they do not possess solid experience in 100% of these areas. Even if it seems you don't meet our musts don't let it stop you, we are all about finding the best talent out there! Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable.

We Believe Driven Talent Deserves


🌟 An enticing equity plan that lets you own a piece of the action.
💪 Top-notch private health insurance to keep you at your peak.
🍔 Monthly Glovo credit to satisfy your cravings!
💳 Cobee discounts on transportation, food, and even kindergarten expenses.
🏊 Discounted gym memberships to keep you energized.
🏖️ Extra time off, the freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year!
👪 Enhanced parental leave, and office-based nursery.
🧠 Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being.


Here at Glovo, we thrive on diversity, we believe it enhances our teams, products, and culture. We know that the best ideas come from a mashup of brilliant diverse minds. This is why we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds - all genders, racial/diverse backgrounds, abilities, ages, sexual orientations and all other unique characteristics that make you YOU. We will encourage you to bring your authentic self to work, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels heard.

Feel free to note your pronouns in your application (e.g., she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

So, ready to take the wheel and make this the ride of your life?

Delve into our culture by taking a peek at our Instagram and check out our Linkedin and website!

Delve into our culture by taking a peek at our Instagram and check out our Linkedin and website!

Title: Data Analyst, Retail Media
Description:
What You'll Do:

The Retail Media EMEA Analytics team, part of the rapidly expanding Criteo Retail Media business, leverages our grand set of shopper data to design and develop actionable insights for our Retailer and Brand clients. We bring the analytical perspective onto the business and provide recommendations based on high quality data analysis and strong understanding of our industry and products. We leverage our unique position to provide our commercial teams and clients with visibility into shopper behavior, market trends and product performance that can't be found anywhere else.

Criteo’s high-growth business model brings both opportunities and challenges. This position requires working with large sets of data and a variety of stakeholders to solve complex business problems by thinking strategically and proposing innovative solutions. The ideal candidate functions with minimal oversight and has the ability to learn new concepts quickly.


Mine massive data sets and turn them into understandable and actionable insights
Build scalable analytic solutions using state of the art tools of Criteo analytics stack (Hadoop, Vertica, PySpark…)
Develop innovative analytical approaches to measure Brands & Retailers’ performance from design to presentation of results, leveraging all our expertise in Data Science (statistical thinking, A/B testing, bootstrapping, data visualization…)
Frequently interact with other teams (R&D, product, commercial teams…) and clients to share data-driven recommendations and insights
Develop and maintain deep knowledge of Criteo Retail Media products and technologies as they evolve



Who You Are:

You are passionate about data and want to work with leading edge technologies in online industry:


You have at least 2 years’ experience in Data Science or Data Analytics
Master’s degree or higher in a quantitative field (Engineering, Mathematics, Computer Science, Physics, etc.)
Fluency in the core toolkit of Data Science/Data Analytics: SQL is required, Python is a real asset (master most common data libraries: pandas, numpy…)
Outstanding analytical skills: passion for translating data-speak into relevant, compelling stories
A background in the digital industry or consulting is a plus
You have the combination of technical skills, passion for learning, and the soft skills to work with all personality types in a dynamic environment
You are fluent in English



We acknowledge that many candidates may not meet every single role requirement listed above. If your experience looks a little different from our requirements but you believe that you can still bring value to the role, we’d love to see your application!

Who We Are:

Criteo is the global commerce media company that enables marketers and media owners to deliver richer consumer experiences and drive better commerce outcomes through its industry leading Commerce Media Platform.

At Criteo, our culture is as unique as it is diverse. From our offices around the world or from home, our incredible team of 3,600 Criteos collaborates to develop an open and inclusive environment. We seek to ensure that all of our workers are treated equally, and we do not tolerate discrimination based on race, gender identity, gender, sexual orientation, color, national origin, religion, age, disability, political opinion, pregnancy, migrant status, ethnicity, marital or family status, or other protected characteristics at all stages of the employment lifecycle including how we attract and recruit, through promotions, pay decisions, benefits, career progression and development. We aim to ensure employment decisions and actions are based solely on business-related considerations and not on protected characteristics. As outlined in our Code of Business Conduct and Ethics, we strictly forbid any kind of discrimination, harassment, mistreatment or bullying towards colleagues, clients, suppliers, stakeholders, shareholders, or any visitors of Criteo. All of this supports us in our mission to power the world’s marketers with trusted and impactful advertising encouraging discovery, innovation and choice in an open internet.

Why Join Us:

At Criteo, we take pride in being a caring culture and are committed to providing our employees with valuable benefits that support their physical, emotional and financial wellbeing, their interests and the important life events. We aim to create a place where people can grow and learn from each other while having a meaningful impact. We want to set you up for success in your job, and an important part of that includes comprehensive perks & benefits. Benefits may vary depending on the country where you work and the nature of your employment with Criteo. When determining compensation, we carefully consider a wide range of job-related factors, including experience, knowledge, skills, education, and location. These factors can cause your compensation to vary.

Title: Data Analyst, H&B Europe
Description:
Job Description

As a Data Analyst for the Health & Benefits (H&B) Europe Operations team, you will be a pivotal player in supporting our core platform, Benefits Engine, and ensuring the integrity and utility of our data. Your expertise in Excel, PowerBI, SQL, and PowerPlatform will enable you to produce critical ad-hoc reports, maintain and enhance reporting dashboards, and participate in our Global Data Clean-Up Programme as the Business Lead. You will also champion our Data Community across Europe, fostering best practice sharing and skill leveraging to enhance our country teams' capabilities.

The role will report into the H&B Europe Operations Leader, who will also serve as the Compensation Manager.

The Role

As a Data Analyst you will have responsability on below funtions:

Production of Ad-Hoc Reports: Utilise your expert knowledge in Excel, PowerBI, and SQL to generate essential reports, providing insights and supporting decision-making processes.

Creation of Reporting Dashboards: Employ your proficiency in PowerBI to maintain, improve, and develop new reporting dashboards that visualise data effectively for stakeholders.

Data Clean Up Programme Business Lead: Oversee the data cleaning processes as an expert in Benefits Engine and its data architecture. Ensure data accuracy and quality while being accountable for the completion of data cleaning tasks by collaborating with colleagues in-country or within the GSD teams.

Run the Data Community for Europe: Lead the regional data expertise community, currently including Spain, GB, and Netherlands, and expand it to encompass all countries. Facilitate the exchange of best practices and enhance the skills across the region.

PowerPlatform Experience: Demonstrate advanced proficiency with PowerPlatform, including the ability to create and manage workflows, apps, and automations that streamline operations and drive efficiencies.

Platform Connectivity Maintenance: Monitor and maintain the connectivity between Benefits Engine and local servicing platforms in Spain, Italy, Switzerland, and Poland, ensuring seamless integration and data flow.

Benefits Insights: Be a part of the development of the Market Facing Technology (MFT) strategy for Benefits Insights for local clients within Europe. Ensure timely implementation of future clients, suggest enhancements for the tool and oversee issue fixes as and when they occur.

Additional Responsibilities

Data Analysis and Mapping: Apply your data analysis and mapping skills to identify trends, opportunities, and areas for improvement within our data sets.

Stakeholder Engagement: Engage with stakeholders to understand their data needs and deliver solutions that meet or exceed expectations.

Continuous Learning: Stay abreast of the latest developments in data analysis tools and techniques, ensuring that our operations remain cutting-edge and efficient.

Data Factory and Azure AI Builder Expertise: Utilise your knowledge of Azure Data Factory to orchestrate and automate data movement and transformation. Leverage Azure AI Builder to infuse AI into applications, enhancing data analysis and insights.

Qualifications

The Requirements


Proven experience in data analysis, reporting, and dashboard creation.
Strong working knowledge of Excel, PowerBI, SQL, Benefits Engine, and preferably Benefits Insights, PowerPlatform, Azure Data Factory, and Azure AI Builder.
Experience in leading data-related communities and initiatives.
Familiarity with data cleaning processes and data quality management.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent communication and collaboration abilities.
Detail-oriented with a commitment to quality.
Ability to speak other European languages in addition to English an advantage, but not critical.


Equal Opportunity Employeer

Title: Finance Reporting Data Analyst - SQL Advanced - (100% remote-friendly within Spain)
Description:
We are the largest digital healthcare platform in the world, present in 15 countries and currently connecting over 30 million patients to more than 2 million healthcare professionals. We seek to make the experience in health more human and we live and breath this mission.


We obsess over the challenge of minimizing patients' pain and helping healthcare professionals thrive managing their patients and expand their online presence. Through services that bring health to users, we provide a space for questions, opinions and a way to find the health professional that best fits your needs.


To deliver the best result, we have motivated people with an innovative spirit, giving everyone the opportunity to actively contribute and grow within the company. The DocPlanner team is our secret sauce and for the 2nd consecutive year we were recognized as a Great Place To Work. We love diversity because each unique individual's perspective makes us stronger. We encourage everyone to participate in our hiring process. We’d love for you to bring your unique skill set and join the team!




Job Description



The resource, working within the Financial Reporting team, will play a key role in supporting the evolution of financial reporting in a challenging and stimulating environment. You will help bridge the gap between finance and BI. Our primary objective is to assist the business in making decisions based on data, with a particular emphasis on producing reports as the primary and most reliable source of information.


A team of 12 experts provides support to various departments, including marketing, sales, customer success, finance, and people experience, for both short-term and long-term projects. Collaborating closely with stakeholders, we strive to develop reports, analyses, models, and recommendations that enable us to gain a deep understanding of how we can enhance the satisfaction of both doctors and patients.


You will be an integral part of the Financial Reporting team, working closely with the Data Analytics team to support business decisions based on data.

How would you be impacting our mission


Financial Reporting and Analysis:
Track key financial metrics and KPIs, ensuring they align with organizational goals;
Develop and maintain comprehensive financial dashboards using advanced BI tools;
Provide detailed insights into financial performance, trends, and variances;
Provide insights for long-term strategic decisions;
Data Management and Integration:
Ensure accurate and timely collection of financial data from systems like Oracle NetSuite;
Integrate data from multiple sources for a unified financial view;
Performance Measurement:
Analyze profitability and cost efficiency to identify improvement areas;
Regulatory and Compliance Reporting:
Support audits and for regulatory documentation;
Automation and Process Improvement:
Automate repetitive financial tasks to improve efficiency;
Implement process improvements to reduce manual efforts and errors;
Enhanced Reporting and Visualization:
Utilize BI tools like Tableau for dynamic, interactive reports and dashboards;
Enhance report quality and accessibility beyond traditional spreadsheets.


Qualifications



What will help you thrive?


Bachelor's degree in Economics, Statistics, Econometrics or a related field.
Demonstrable experience in using SQL to derive actionable insights, either in commercial or academic setting (must have).
Knowledge of Python/R and desire to expand your knowledge.
Experience with statistical modeling and descriptive statistics.
Experience in partnership with internal stakeholders.
Experience in leading and executing end to end BI projects.
Strong written and oral communication skills in English; proficiency in other languages such as German, Spanish, and Italian is a plus.
Ability to gather, organize, analyze, and report large volumes of financial data with speed and accuracy.
Strong attention to detail with the ability to provide high-quality work efficiently.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Ability to adapt and work in a quickly changing environment, managing competing demands.

Which skills are ‘bonus points’?


Master's degree in Economics, Statistics, Econometrics or a related field.
Able to take a step back from the technicalities and examine them through a business lens.
Open to cooperating with a lot of people from many teams in different countries.
Like to see the instant effects of your work.
Knowledge of ERP finance applications (Oracle, Oracle - NetSuite, SAP).
Relevant experience in accounting and financial reporting.


Additional Information



What will you get in return?


Let’s talk money


Flexible remuneration and benefits system via Flexoh, which includes: restaurant card, transportation card, kindergarten, and training tax savings;
Share options plan after 6 months of working with us

True flexibility and work-life balance


Remote first in one of our legal entities or hybrid work model in one of our office locations;
Flexible working hours;
Paid time off according to your location of work;
Additional paid holiday on your birthday or work anniversary (you choose what you want to celebrate).

Health comes first


Health insurance according to your location of work:
Access to iFeel, a technological platform for mental wellness offering online psychological support and counseling.

What does the recruitment process look like?


A 30-minute meeting with Ro - Head of International Talent Acquisition
SHL test
A 45-minute meeting with Nicolò Truffa - Head of Financial reporting
A 60-minute meeting Wiktor Kulikowski - Business Intelligence Manager including the live SQL testing
Business Case - Prepare a Business Case
Present it within the with Nico and Wiktor for 90 minutes
Meet the Team for 15 minute meeting

Please submit your CV exclusively in English.


We promote and embrace equal opportunities in our hiring process, and also every day at work. When you apply for our roles you receive equal treatment regardless of age, disabilities, gender reassignment, marital or civil partner status, pregnancy or parental status, race, colour, nationality, ethnic or national origin, religion or belief, sex, sexual orientation or any other dimension of human difference. If you require additional support in your recruitment process, we kindly encourage you to let us know. Behind those words you’re reading, there’s a person (hi!) who already helped a candidate by adapting the interviews, and now we’re lucky to have this person with us. So, even if you’ve never asked for it before, may this serve as a sign that, now, you can do so. We can only truly be equal if we adapt to each other.


“We believe all humans, in all their beautiful diversity, should have equal rights, dignity and respect. Period.” Mariusz Gralewski, CEO
