Title: Data Support Analyst
Description:
Who is Clever?

Clever Advertising is a multinational digital brand serving the iGaming industry for the last 15 years with innovative advertising and technology solutions.

We are dedicated to your professional and personal growth in an environment that values knowledge-sharing and mentorship.




Why joining Clever?

Working with us means joining a diverse team where each member contributes to collective success, supporting one another through shared goals and passions. We not only focus on achieving excellent results but also enjoy the journey, making every day both fulfilling and fun.




Where will I work from?

Porto, Portugal.




What is my department like?

Our Technology Department is the driving force behind the innovations that propel our company forward. Committed to creating scalable and high-quality solutions, we work in a collaborative environment where every idea matters. Our teams of experts in development, infrastructure, security, and data intelligence are driven by a passion for solving complex challenges and delivering impactful results. We value diversity of thought and believe that the best solutions arise from collaboration between diverse and creative minds




What is my role like?

We are looking for a dedicated and detail-oriented Data Support Analyst to join our Data Management team. The ideal candidate will have effective communication skills, attention to detail, and the ability to work collaboratively with various departments, ensuring that data operations are executed with accuracy and efficiency.




What will my daily tasks involve?

Assist the Data Management team in interacting with other departments, facilitating communication and collaboration to ensure that data projects meet the needs of all stakeholders.
Manage and resolve first-level support tickets related to data, including issues with dashboards, RPA bots, and data loading processes.
Monitor and ensure that dashboard loads are executed correctly, identifying and resolving any performance or loading issues.
Validate bots developed by the RPA team, ensuring they function as expected and comply with established requirements.
Create and maintain detailed documentation for data processes, RPA bots, and support procedures, ensuring that information is always up-to-date and accessible.




What is expected from me?

Minimum of 1 year of experience in data support, data analysis, or similar roles.
Familiarity with BI tools (Power BI, Tableau, etc.).
Basic knowledge of SQL and ETL practices.
Ability to maintain technical documentation.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills.
Ability to solve problems quickly and effectively.
Attention to detail and accuracy when working with data are differentiating factors.




What can I expect from Clever?

A competitive remuneration package
Superior health benefits
Employee cafeteria featuring meals approved by our nutritionist
Wellbeing support through our Happiness Department, including 24/7 medical app access,complimentary nutritional consultations, psychological support, and wellness webinars.
A commitment to professional growth with tailored development plans and opportunities for internal career moves.
An education-rich workplace with access to the Clever Academy and language learning opportunities.
A balanced approach to work-life dynamics.




At Clever, we believe in diversity and inclusion as drivers of innovation. We foster a work environment free from discrimination, where everyone has equal opportunities to succeed.




Ready to make a Clever choice?

Show more
HTML:
Who is Clever?

Clever Advertising is a multinational digital brand serving the iGaming industry for the last 15 years with innovative advertising and technology solutions.

We are dedicated to your professional and personal growth in an environment that values knowledge-sharing and mentorship.


Why joining Clever?

Working with us means joining a diverse team where each member contributes to collective success, supporting one another through shared goals and passions. We not only focus on achieving excellent results but also enjoy the journey, making every day both fulfilling and fun.


Where will I work from?

Porto, Portugal.


What is my department like?

Our Technology Department is the driving force behind the innovations that propel our company forward. Committed to creating scalable and high-quality solutions, we work in a collaborative environment where every idea matters. Our teams of experts in development, infrastructure, security, and data intelligence are driven by a passion for solving complex challenges and delivering impactful results. We value diversity of thought and believe that the best solutions arise from collaboration between diverse and creative minds


What is my role like?

We are looking for a dedicated and detail-oriented Data Support Analyst to join our Data Management team. The ideal candidate will have effective communication skills, attention to detail, and the ability to work collaboratively with various departments, ensuring that data operations are executed with accuracy and efficiency.


What will my daily tasks involve?

  • Assist the Data Management team in interacting with other departments, facilitating communication and collaboration to ensure that data projects meet the needs of all stakeholders.
  • Manage and resolve first-level support tickets related to data, including issues with dashboards, RPA bots, and data loading processes.
  • Monitor and ensure that dashboard loads are executed correctly, identifying and resolving any performance or loading issues.
  • Validate bots developed by the RPA team, ensuring they function as expected and comply with established requirements.
  • Create and maintain detailed documentation for data processes, RPA bots, and support procedures, ensuring that information is always up-to-date and accessible.


What is expected from me?

  • Minimum of 1 year of experience in data support, data analysis, or similar roles.
  • Familiarity with BI tools (Power BI, Tableau, etc.).
  • Basic knowledge of SQL and ETL practices.
  • Ability to maintain technical documentation.
  • Excellent communication and collaboration skills.
  • Ability to solve problems quickly and effectively.
  • Attention to detail and accuracy when working with data are differentiating factors.


What can I expect from Clever?

  • A competitive remuneration package
  • Superior health benefits
  • Employee cafeteria featuring meals approved by our nutritionist
  • Wellbeing support through our Happiness Department, including 24/7 medical app access,complimentary nutritional consultations, psychological support, and wellness webinars.
  • A commitment to professional growth with tailored development plans and opportunities for internal career moves.
  • An education-rich workplace with access to the Clever Academy and language learning opportunities.
  • A balanced approach to work-life dynamics.


At Clever, we believe in diversity and inclusion as drivers of innovation. We foster a work environment free from discrimination, where everyone has equal opportunities to succeed.


Ready to make a Clever choice?

Title: Data Analyst(Tableau Expert)
HTML:
Procuramos qualidade e força de vontade !

Gostas de partilhar, celebrar o sucesso em conjunto?

Escutas, pensas e propões?

Utilizas o inesperado para ter sucesso?

Gostas de inspirar os outros com a tua atitude?


Be the NEX T Data Analyst(Tableau Expert)!!!


Main Responsibilities:


  • Design and maintain dashboards in Tableau;
  • Design data ingestion pipelines to gather data from various sources such as databases, APIs, and files;
  • Design data processing pipelines to clean, filter, and pre-process data for analysis;
  • Optimize data pipelines, framework code, cluster utilization, and configuration to ensure the best performance from pipelines;
  • Design, maintain, and enforce data governance and data catalog;
  • Maintain a coherent documentation of the framework, cluster, and projects;
  • Collaborate with data scientists, data analysts, and stakeholders to elicit data requirements and deliver effective solutions;


Technical skills:


  • Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering or a related field;
  • 3+ years of experience as a Data Analyst;
  • Strong proficiency in Python;
  • Knowledge of Apache Spark, Apache Hadoop, Airflow, and Presto;
  • Proficiency in SQL queries and a good understanding of database architecture;
  • Experience creating data sources and dashboards on Data Visualization software like Tableau and PowerBI;
  • Familiarity with in-house big data platforms;
  • Good knowledge of data modeling, data structures, data management, and best practices;
  • Familiarity with containerization and orchestration technologies.



A NEX T é uma consultora tecnológica que actua a nível nacional e internacional, com principal foco na área de IT, Marketing Digital, Data Mining, Data Science e Automação de Processos.

Oferecemos:

  • Remuneração compatível com a experiência profissional;
  • Evolução de carreira;
  • Acompanhamento personalizado;
  • Plano de Formação;
  • Oportunidade para fazer parte de uma equipa em grande crescimento.


Your NEX T step is right here!

Partilha o teu cv para fernando.garcia@nextengineering.pt com a REFª FGA

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
At AXIANS we seek the right talent, for the right place. We work daily to involve our people in a collaborative and inclusive environment, with a culture of proximity. Also, part of our culture is our concern for the environment and the implementation of social and environmental corporate responsibility actions.

This could be your opportunity to join a project of international scope, with a client that needs you to meet the challenges of digital transformation.

💻 THE ROLE

We are looking for a #TechTalent to work as a Data Analyst for an international project in the banking sector.

💡 What We're Looking For

  • Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering or a related field;
  • 3+ years of experience as a Data Analyst;
  • Strong proficiency in Python (proven experience developing data-related Python frameworks is a plus);
  • Knowledge on Apache Spark, Apache Hadoop, Airflow and Presto (proven experience is a plus);
  • Proficiency in SQL queries and a good understanding of database architecture;
  • Experience creating data sources and dashboards on Tableau and PowerBI;
  • Familiarity with in-house big data platforms;
  • Strong analytical skills to ensure data quality;
  • Excellent communication skills and the ability to work effectively in a collaborative and multi-cultural team environment;
  • Fluency in English;

⭐ What You Can Expect From Us

Stable professional career

Working with Axians projects becomes an asset to those of us who want to offer stability through a secure career.

Prospects for career advancement

You can access training and new certifications that will further elevate your skills. The 360° evaluation from managers and peers will also allow you to evolve.

Work Life Balance

By collaborating with Axians, you will be able to reconcile work and family requirements without neglecting either area.

Attractive, Evolving Compensation

When working with Axians, you will have access to performance bonuses in addition to an attractive salary pack (base salary + benefits). You are also entitled to health insurance and free psychology consultations.

Do you identify with this position?

If you think this position is the right fit for you and you have the #TechTalent we are looking for, send us your resume, preferably in English and in Europass format, to recrutamento.axianspt@axians.com with the subject DA/AT/MO”.

Learn more about Axians

Title: Senior BI/Data analyst
Description:
Intro

PETE.Tech, powered by one of Germany's largest company builders, with a 20+ year track record and 30+ successful companies, is on a mission to become a leading Tech Hub in the European and US startup & grownup scene.

We empower companies in hot tech spaces like sustainability, green energy, recycling, social media, and Web3 by building the technology they need to thrive. Our engineers work closely with these companies, gaining deep insights and actively shaping the development of impactful products and technologies.

Now, PETE.Tech is expanding its talented team in Portugal and Brazil. Are you a passionate and experienced Data Engineer ready to make a difference? Join us!




Lead the Data Revolution in Green Energy

We're seeking a seasoned Data Engineer to lead the architectural decisions and implementation of a revolutionary product for one of our key clients in the green energy sector. This is your chance to build a cutting-edge data infrastructure from the ground up, empowering our client to optimize and manage their solar and wind farms with unprecedented efficiency.

In this role, you will:

Be the Architect: Design and implement a robust and scalable data warehouse solution to handle large volumes of data from various sources related to solar and wind energy production.
Drive Innovation: Utilize your expertise in data warehousing, ETL processes, and cloud technologies to build a data platform that enables advanced analytics, predictive modeling, and real-time insights.
Collaborate Closely: Work directly with our client and internal teams in Portugal and Brazil to understand their needs, translate them into technical requirements, and deliver impactful solutions.
Champion Best Practices: Establish and maintain high standards for data quality, security, and governance throughout the data lifecycle.
Embrace Continuous Learning: Stay at the forefront of data engineering trends and technologies, constantly seeking ways to improve our solutions and processes.




Do you have what it takes?

We're looking for someone with:

5+ years of experience in Business Intelligence (BI), Data Engineering, and Data Analysis projects.
2+ years of experience leading small teams, projects, or products.
Proven experience building data warehouses from the ground up, including design, implementation, and operation.
Experience with Data Vault modeling (design, implementation, operation) is highly valuable.
Strong expertise in data analysis, data modeling, and data visualization tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau).
Proficiency in SQL for data extraction, manipulation, and analysis.
Experience with data warehousing concepts and working with large datasets in cloud environments (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud). Snowflake experience is a plus.
Expert in ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes and tools.
Excellent communication skills in English.
A collaborative mindset that values diverse viewpoints.
Passion for delivering high-quality solutions and learning new technologies.
Interest in being part of a fast-growing tech startup scene and collaborating with people from diverse backgrounds.




Join the PETE.Tech Pack!

We offer a competitive compensation package and a vibrant work environment where you can thrive:

Growth & Transparency: Clear career progression plan and open communication.
Work-Life Balance: Flexible home office arrangements and working hours.
Hybrid Work Model: Enjoy the best of both worlds with in-office and remote work options.
Team Spirit: Monthly get-togethers and social events.
Comprehensive Benefits: Meal allowance, health insurance, and PETE.Tech's Virtual Stock Option Program (VSOP).

Title: Fullstack Data Analyst
Description:
Decskill, founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company, places paramount importance on its greatest asset: its people. Our main mission is to deliver value through knowledge and talent, and we achieve this by fostering a culture of excellence and investing in the development and well-being of our people. With over 600 dedicated professionals and offices in Lisbon, Porto, Madrid, and Luxembourg, Decskill operates across three core areas:




DECSKILL TALENT: We believe that our people are key to our success. Through Decskill Talent, we empower our team to embrace the digital transformation challenges of our clients. We collaborate with clients to drive innovation, ensuring project success and business growth.
DECSKILL BOOST: Equipping our team with the latest tools and methodologies, we optimize Time-to-Market and deliver innovative solutions exceeding client expectations.
DECSKILL CONNECT: Our team collaborates closely with clients to implement and manage IT infrastructures that generate long-term value.




At Decskill, we believe that by nurturing and empowering our people to confront the challenges of digital transformation, we create value not only for our clients but also for our entire ecosystem, fostering a digital community dedicated to growth and progress.




We are looking for an Fullstack Data Analyst!




Responsibilities:

Understand the company’s requirements and identify KPIs for the development of dashboards related to cyber security risk management.
Collect, clean, and transform data sets using ETL tools to create effective data models.
Develop and maintain dashboards and ensure the accuracy and availability of data related to managing cyber security risks.
Use Dataiku and PostgreSQL for data processing and analysis, including statistical techniques.
Leverage on machine learning algorithms to identify additional insights and define non explicit correlations between indicators.
Present findings to stakeholders in a clear and concise manner, making recommendations for action when appropriate to improve Dashboard production.
Continuously improve the accuracy and usability of data by monitoring data quality and developing new data models.
Demonstrate excellent problem-solving skills and a proactive approach to identifying problems and provide solutions.
Work effectively with other team members (in various locations), to ensure effective and efficient execution of projects.
Manage several projects and priorities, demonstrating a satisfactory level of autonomy and time management skills.




Requirements:

A bachelor's degree in computer science, statistics, mathematics, or a related subject.
3+ years of experience as data Analyst, developing Dashboard and DataViz
Knowledge of algorithms is a plus and will enable the candidate to be a force for proposing useful content related to cyber security risk management.
Expertise with POWERBI, TABLEAU, DATAIKU, PostgreSQL and ETL tools (e.g., TABLEAU Certified Data Analyst, DATAIKU Advanced Designer Certificate)
Experience with other data visualization tools such as POWERBI
Basic Python skills.
Good level of english.




If you’re interested in this job please send your CV to cesaltina.abreu@decskill.com, with the reference “FullstackData”.




Thank you! :)




Decskill is committed to equality and non-discrimination with all our talents. We recruit and promote talent, based on diversity and inclusion, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, race, nationality or any other form of discrimination incompatible with the dignity of the human being.

Title: Financial Resources Data Analyst
Description:
About The Job

The Financial Resources Data Analyst plays an important and accountable role in providing support on the management of Global Markets Resources, namely Liquidity, Balance Sheet and Capital and the monitoring of future regulations.

The Financial Resources Data Analyst measures, allocates and optimizes Resources to ensure that the operational entity grows revenue, market share, and profitability in a sustainable way.

Your Main Activities Are


Collect, Prepare, consolidate data and Monitoring and keep track of Gaps on Global Markets Resources.
Responsible for database production and maintenance.
Assist on the preparation of presentations on topics related to Global Market resources.
Provides assistance to incoming requests from different regulators.
Responsible for producing GM Resources metrics, following a continuous improvement mindset (acquiring and building knowledge on the different business Lines, units and organization).
Develop knowledge on technical skills and apply those in order to efficiently perform the tasks.
Build knowledge and understanding on the 5 main types for Global markets and Help monitor those - Credit; Counterparty; Equity; Market; Operational.
Build knowledge and easiness in the main tools and software used by the team.


Profile And Skills To Success


Bachelors/MSc in Economics, Finance and Accounting
Very good communication skills
Analytical ability, attention to details, autonomy
Ability to collaborate/Teamwork
Proactivity
Risk management - Risk analysis
Technical skills – R, VBA and Python


Show more

Title: Lead Insight Analyst
Description:
Lead Insight Analyst required to joining our rapidly expanding Data Analytics team on a permanent basis in Portugal.

The opportunity:

As a Lead Insight Analyst you will have the opportunity to work on some of our largest projects and key accounts. Reporting to the Head of Data Analytics, you will be responsible for analysing digital behaviour in order to provide key, actionable insight and critical recommendations to our clients. This is more than just an insight role; it’s an opportunity to help shape the digital strategies of some of the world’s leading brands and retailers! You will be tool agnostic and you will use tools like Google Analytics and Adobe Analytics for tracking data, GTM, Adobe Launch or Tealium for implementing tags and a mixture of data visualization tool as well as Excel and Powerpoint for visualisation. Additionally, you will be managing a small team of Analysts and will be providing oversight to ensure that their delivering tool quality analysis outputs.

Please note that this job is a full-time position located in Lisbon or Porto, but the selection process will be conducted in English.

Please send over your CV in English




What you’ll be doing:

Shaping, sell and deliver large analytics programs of work.
Creating measurement plans that identify the customer behaviour to be tracked (you will work closely with our implementation analysts for this)
Establishing detailed reporting and visualisations that help our clients understand the performance of their digital channels
Using measurement tools to analyse digital user behaviours in detail, across a wide range of digital properties (websites, mobile applications, instore devices)
Creating detailed insight reports that cover key findings and recommendations
Presenting your findings to a senior-level client audience and helping them understand what it means for their business
Working with our internal UX and design teams to inform the creation of new websites and apps
Answering client queries and running training sessions with them
Having line management duties for a small team of analysts, including developing their skillset and driving the quality of their work

What we want from you:

Extensive experience working as a Lead Analyst providing insight, ideally in an ecommerce setting (client or agency)
Must have Advanced practical knowledge of Analytics tools (Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics, Content Square)
Numerically adept in using Excel (or similar) to analyse data
Previous experience supporting junior team members
Highly proficient in Microsoft Word and PowerPoint
Extensive experience working with senior client stakeholders
Effective time management and multitasking abilities
A proven track record of delivering large insight projects for leading B2C organisations

What we can offer you:

Alongside the opportunity to work with some of the most exciting brands around the world, we’ll also prioritise your career development and help you grow your skills. We’ll empower you to make a difference, allow you to be yourself, and respect who you are.

We offer a great benefits package including hybrid working that works for everyone, social events, training opportunities, medical and dental insurance, life assurance, meal cards and much more.

Our personality and behaviours: We believe that we are what we do, not just what we say. Our shared values and behaviours show how to bring the VML Enterprise Solution's culture to life through the actions we all take every day:

Connect Meaningfully
Inspire Creatively
Include Purposefully
Approach Positively




Our brilliant, talented people are what makes VML Enterprise Solutions what we are. That’s why we look for people who go beyond and always push our thinking to be better than yesterday.

AT VML Enterprise Solutions

Our Enterprise Solutions division houses strategic consultants, creative and technical architects and skilled developers and operators that together help some of the world’s leading organisations to deliver outstanding digital experiences across all major routes to market worldwide: marketplaces, online retailers, D2C, B2B and social platforms. With over 4,200 experts in 55 operational centres across 34 countries, our capabilities span the entire buying journey from customer acquisition, through engagement, to conversion and loyalty, driving multi-channel growth for world-leading brands.

We work with some of the most exciting brands such as The Coca-Cola Company, EY, Bosch, Unilever, Ford, DFS, Mercedes-Benz, Johnson & Johnson, Nestlé, Sainsbury’s, Selfridges, Shell and Tiffany & Co. We’ve built over 500 platforms for brands and retailers and generate in excess of $29bn annually for our clients and work with over 50 strategic partners including Adobe, SAP, Salesforce, HCL, Shopify, Sitecore, BigCommerce, commerce tools and Acquia. Our reputation is based on our people, and we believe we have some of the best in the business.

As our business grows internationally, we’re looking for new people to join us on our journey to inspire and take a key role in shaping some of the best commerce solutions, services, and websites in the world. Working as a team, no problem is insurmountable; we share in our client’s successes and believe that anyone can show creative bravery no matter what their role is in the team.

In our Lisbon or Porto office, you’ll join a team of other specialists who are always ready to help each other. The team is part of our Enterprise Solutions network and works in coordination with our Local and EMEA client leads.

#LI-EMEA #LI-HYBRID #LI-JM1

Show more

Working as a team, no problem is insurmountable; we share in our client’s successes and believe that anyone can show creative bravery no matter what their role is in the team.

In our Lisbon or Porto office, you’ll join a team of other specialists who are always ready to help each other. The team is part of our Enterprise Solutions network and works in coordination with our Local and EMEA client leads.

#LI-EMEA #LI-HYBRID #LI-JM1

Title: Full Stack Data Analyst
Description:
🤔Who are we?




As the founding entity of RAINBOW PARTNERS, Quanteam is a consulting firm specializing in the fields of Banking, Finance, and Financial Services. Guided by our core values of closeness, teamwork, diversity, and excellence, our team of 740 expert consultants, representing 35 different nationalities, collaborates across 10 international offices: Paris, Lyon, New York, Montreal, London, Brussels, Geneva, Lisbon, Porto and Casablanca. Committed to sustainability (Ecovadis Gold), diversity (gender index: 92%), and quality of work life (Best Workplace Experience), Quanteam is a forward-thinking enterprise.




🚀 Our Expertise




With a dual expertise in both business and IT, Quanteam supports its corporate clients (investment banks, asset management companies, private and retail banks, custodians, etc.) across the entire Front-to-Back spectrum in evolving their business activities and transformation projects.




Our teams are organized into 5 expertise areas:

➡ Quantitative Finance

➡ Risk, Compliance, and Regulatory

➡ Operations and Finance

➡ Transformation and Organization

➡ Information Systems

In 2023, Quanteam generated a revenue of €74.6 million.




🔎We are looking for a Full Stack Data Analyst




We are looking for a talented Data Analyst with data science skills, expertise in ETL and DataViz solution.

The candidate will lead dashboard projects from End to End in cyber security risk management.

You will work closely with the other departments and entities within Cyber to identify business needs, design effective data models, develop and maintain dashboards using POWERBI, TABLEAU, DATAIKU and PostgreSQL for data processing and analysis.




YOUR MISSIONS:




Understand the company’s requirements and identify KPIs for the development of dashboards related to cyber security risk management.
Collect, clean, and transform data sets using ETL tools to create effective data models.
Develop and maintain dashboards and ensure the accuracy and availability of data related to managing cyber security risks.
Use Dataiku and PostgreSQL for data processing and analysis, including statistical techniques.
Leverage on machine learning algorithms to identify additional insights and define non explicit correlations between indicators.
Present findings to stakeholders in a clear and concise manner, making recommendations for action when appropriate to improve Dashboard production.
Continuously improve the accuracy and usability of data by monitoring data quality and developing new data models.
Demonstrate excellent problem-solving skills and a proactive approach to identifying problems and provide solutions.







YOUR PROFILE AND SKILLS:




A bachelor's degree in computer science, statistics, mathematics, or a related subject.
3+ years of experience as data Analyst, developing Dashboard and DataViz
Knowledge of algorithms is a plus and will enable the candidate to be a force for proposing useful content related to cyber security risk management.
Expertise with POWERBI, TABLEAU, DATAIKU, PostgreSQL and ETL tools.
Fluent in English.
Hybrid regime in Lisbon or Porto Office (depends on your location).




🚀If you feel this opportunity is for you, send your CV and join our team!

Title: Senior Functional Data Analyst
Description:
Who is Clever?

Clever Advertising is a multinational digital brand serving the iGaming industry for the last 15 years with innovative advertising and technology solutions.

We are dedicated to your professional and personal growth in an environment that values knowledge-sharing and mentorship.




Why joining Clever?

Working with us means joining a diverse team where each member contributes to collective success, supporting one another through shared goals and passions. We not only focus on achieving excellent results but also enjoy the journey, making every day both fulfilling and fun.




Where will I work from?

Porto, Portugal.




What is my department like?

Our Technology Department is the driving force behind the innovations that propel our company forward. Committed to creating scalable and high-quality solutions, we work in a collaborative environment where every idea matters. Our teams of experts in development, infrastructure, security, and data intelligence are driven by a passion for solving complex challenges and delivering impactful results. We value diversity of thought and believe that the best solutions arise from collaboration between diverse and creative minds




What is my role like?

We are looking for an experienced Senior Functional Data Analyst to help consolidate and expand the Business Intelligence (BI) area within our IT department. This professional will be responsible for supporting leadership in defining standards and best practices for data visualization, using Power BI as the primary tool. Additionally, they will play a key role in communication and negotiation with managers, ensuring that BI solutions are effective and aligned with the company's strategic needs.




What will my daily tasks involve?

Assist in creating and implementing standards for the use of Power BI across the organization, ensuring consistency and quality in data visualizations.
Collaborate with IT leadership to develop and execute Business Intelligence strategies that support business objectives.
Work directly with managers to understand data needs and ensure that dashboards and reports are effective for decision-making. Facilitate communication between technical and business teams, ensuring that requirements are clear and feasible.
Create and optimize dashboards and reports in Power BI, ensuring that visualizations are intuitive, actionable, and aligned with business needs.
Monitor the use of BI solutions and implement improvements based on continuous feedback, aiming to enhance the effectiveness of data visualization tools.




What is expected from me?

Experience as a Product Manager, Functional Data Analyst or in related roles, with a strong focus on Business Intelligence and Power BI.
Excellent negotiation and communication skills to effectively interact with stakeholders at different levels and areas.
Proficiency in English, essential for collaboration with international teams and potential expansions in Malta.
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Data Engineering, IT Management, or related fields. A Master's degree is a plus.




What can I expect from Clever?

A competitive remuneration package
Superior health benefits
Employee cafeteria featuring meals approved by our nutritionist
Wellbeing support through our Happiness Department, including 24/7 medical app access, complimentary nutritional consultations, psychological support, and wellness webinars.
A commitment to professional growth with tailored development plans and opportunities for internal career moves.
An education-rich workplace with access to the Clever Academy and language learning opportunities.
A balanced approach to work-life dynamics.




At Clever, we believe in diversity and inclusion as drivers of innovation. We foster a work environment free from discrimination, where everyone has equal opportunities to succeed.




Ready to make a Clever choice?

Title: Internship Global Program - Finance Data Analyst - Jumia (Full Time)
Description:
About Jumia:

Jumia believes that technology has the potential to transform everyday life in Africa for the better. Jumia was built to help consumers access millions of goods and services conveniently and at the best prices while opening up a new way for sellers to reach consumers and grow their businesses.

Listed on the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE) in 2019, Jumia is the leading e-commerce company in Africa, operating in 11 countries. The Jumia platform consists of a marketplace, which connects sellers with consumers, a logistics service, which enables the shipment and delivery of packages from sellers to consumers, and a payment service, JumiaPay, which offers a safe and easy solution to facilitate online payment transactions. The company offers goods across a broad range of categories, such as phones and electronics, home appliances, fast-moving consumer goods, fashion and beauty.

What you will be doing


Enabling faster and better decision-making by our leaders as well as automation of processes
Execution of diverse analytical projects using statistical as well as machine learning techniques to help optimize our business processes
Developing new dashboards; maintaining and optimizing existing reports
Data exploration to understand current data availability; data mining in order to propose new analysis and evaluate the feasibility of fulfilling new information requests from management
Ensuring that the data contained within our business reporting is accurate, clean and in line with the definitions as per the business function owner
Contribute to preparing data requests for systems teams in order to facilitate the automation of the reporting domain
Planning and tracking own work against business and project deadlines.


What we are looking for


Bachelor's degree in Business, Engineering or IT-related field
Proficiency in SQL languages and in Microsoft applications (PowerBI, Excel) is highly desirable
Knowledge of statistical programming languages like R and/or Python is a "plus"
Strong communicator, a strategic mindset with good analytical and problem-solving skills
Proficiency in English


We Offer:


A unique experience in an entrepreneurial, yet structured environment
A unique opportunity of having strong impact in building the African e-commerce sector
The opportunity to become part of a highly professional and dynamic team
An unparalleled personal and professional growth as our longer term objective is to train the next generation of leaders


Please ensure to only apply for jobs with Jumia through our official website.

Jumia will never charge you a fee to apply for a job: be wary of websites that claim to help you apply for a Jumia job or that charge a fee to get you a job.

Title: Data Engineer / Data Visualization Specialist
Description:
📢 A nossa missão:

A Ivy Partners é uma empresa suíça de consulting que contribui para a evolução das empresas nos seus desafios estratégicos, tecnológicos e organizacionais.

A nossa missão é oferecer aos nossos colaboradores uma carreira que contribua positivamente para a sua realização e bem-estar, criando um ambiente de apoio onde todos são valorizados e capacitados com formação e perspectivas de crescimento.

👩‍💻🧑‍💻 Como Data Engineer / Data Visualization Specialist irás:

- Projetar e manter pipelines de dados eficientes e escaláveis com Snowflake e Databricks.

- Desenvolver e otimizar modelos de dados para suportar relatórios e dashboards no Power BI.

- Trabalhar em estreita colaboração com as equipas de negócios para compreender as suas necessidades de dados e criar soluções apropriadas.

- Implementar processos ETL (Extração, Transformação, Carga) robustos e eficientes.

- Manter a integridade e qualidade dos dados, monitorizando e resolvendo questões de desempenho.

- Criar e atualizar documentação técnica e guias de utilização.




🏅 Sobre ti!

Esta posição será perfeita para ti se:

- Educação: Licenciatura em Ciência da Computação, Engenharia de Dados, ou área relacionada.

- Experiência: Mínimo de 5 anos como Engenheiro de Dados, com foco em visualização de dados.

- Competências Técnicas:

- Proficiência em Snowflake e Databricks (Avançado)

- Experiência com Power BI (Confirmado)

- Conhecimentos sólidos em SQL e Python ou outras linguagens de programação relevantes (Avançado)

- Competências avançadas em processos ETL

- Competências Interpessoais:

- Capacidade de comunicar eficazmente com stakeholders técnicos e não técnicos

- Proficiência em inglês é uma vantagem

E se humanamente falando:

És analítico, rigoroso e tens um bom espírito de equipa
Tens fortes capacidades de comunicação e uma mentalidade fantástica

🤝 A Ivy, também é sobre:

Zelo | Oferecemos um ambiente de apoio onde todos são valorizados e capacitados com formação e perspetiva de crescimento.

Confiança | Trabalhar connosco é estabelecer uma parceria baseada na confiança, profissionalismo e transparência em todos os momentos.

Inovação | Potenciamos a transformação digital efectiva através de uma combinação única de tecnologia inovadora e pensamento criativo.

Responsabilidade | A comunidade está no centro de tudo o que fazemos, e levamos essa responsabilidade a sério, trabalhando arduamente para criar um impacto positivo.

🚀 Juntares-te à Ivy significa fazer parte de uma aventura desafiante a cada passo!

Obrigado por considerares juntar-te a nós, estamos ansiosos para ouvir mais sobre ti!

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
M/F







DESAFIO:




Esta posição, integrada na equipa de Data Intelligence, constitui uma oportunidade única para se focar na centralização, coerência, fiabilidade e velocidade dos dados para várias áreas de negócio. É uma função essencial para otimizar o desempenho das análises e do conhecimento obtido pela organização.

Este profissional terá um papel fundamental no desenvolvimento de métodos e processos que garantam a organização correta e segura dos dados, que envolve a criação de modelos de dados consistentes e normalizados, além de assegurar a qualidade dos dados armazenados, preparados e disponibilizados através de pipelines para uso analítico e operacional.










PRINCIPAIS RESPONSABILIDADES:




• Desenvolver e Automatizar Pipelines: criar, automatizar e manter pipelines de dados usando processos CI/CD para transformar dados em informações úteis e acionáveis.

• Colaboração: colaborar com analistas de negócio e dados para melhorar os modelos de dados que alimentam as ferramentas de BI, aumentando a acessibilidade dos dados e promovendo decisões orientadas por dados em toda a organização.

• Governança de Dados: assegurar que as políticas de segurança de dados estejam alinhadas com os regulamentos de proteção de dados.

• Monitorização da Qualidade dos Dados: desenvolver, testar e manter sistemas para monitorizar a qualidade dos dados, garantindo que os dados de produção estejam sempre atualizados e disponíveis para os principais intervenientes e processos empresariais.

• Desenvolvimento de Estratégia: colaborar com todas as unidades de negócio e equipas técnicas para desenvolver a estratégia de uma arquitetura de dados a longo prazo.

• Apoio à Equipa: partilhar conhecimentos técnicos e de dados com outros membros da equipa, ajudando na coordenação de projetos e prioridades.










PERFIL:




• Formação Académica: Licenciatura Informática, Engenharia, Ciências de Dados (áreas similares)

• Experiência: +3 anos de experiência prática em engenharia de dados

• Conhecimentos Técnicos: experiência com plataformas cloud, modelação de dados, batch e streaming workloads, e bases de dados

• Tecnologias: familiaridade com tecnologias como Snowflake, Airflow, Python, Kafka, Azure Data Factory, entre outras

• Microsoft BI: conhecimento em tecnologias Microsoft BI (SSIS, SSAS, SSRS, Power BI)

• Habilidades Analíticas: capacidade analítica forte e atenção aos detalhes

• Relacionamento Interpessoal: excelente relacionamento interpessoal e habilidade para trabalhar em equipa

• Proatividade: dinamismo, proatividade e autonomia.







O QUE OFERECEMOS:




• Ambiente Inovador: trabalho com as tecnologias mais recentes num ambiente dinâmico

• Crescimento Profissional: oportunidades de desenvolvimento profissional contínuo

• Colaboração: um ambiente de trabalho colaborativo e de apoio mútuo.

• Impacto Real: participação em projetos que têm um impacto direto e significativo nos negócios.







Se és apaixonado por dados e ambicionas fazer parte de uma equipa que valoriza inovação e colaboração, gostaríamos de ter a oportunidade de te conhecer!

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
We're building the future of advertising and are looking for innovative minds to help us do it.

Darkroom is a vertically integrated digital agency pioneering the next generation of consumer-facing brands. A category leader in results-driven growth marketing, Darkroom’s success is attributed to our unique partnership model, purposefully built to launch brands to market and accelerate growth across direct-to-consumer. We work with game-changing brands such as Crate & Barrel, Popchips, FEED, Olipop, & CALPAK.

Position Overview:

We're seeking a Data Engineer with a strong background in ETL processes, BigQuery, and Python to support a wide array of data engineering projects for our agency and enterprise clients. This role will focus on maintaining and optimizing our data infrastructure, ensuring the seamless flow of data, and providing the backbone for our data-driven decision-making.

This role supports teams working in US Eastern Standard/Daylight Time and should be flexible to support and work in these times.

What You’ll Do:


Design, build, and maintain scalable ETL processes to support data flow from various sources.
Maintain and optimize our BigQuery database, ensuring high performance and data integrity.
Write, troubleshoot, and optimize SQL queries to support various data needs.
Use Python to automate data processes, integrate data sources, and enhance data workflows.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including Operations, Product, Marketing & Sales, Finance, and Engineering, to solve complex data problems.
Develop and maintain dashboards and reports in Looker Studio to provide actionable insights to clients and internal teams.
Ensure continuous improvement of data processes through iterative testing and learning strategies.


You Should Apply If This Sounds Like You:


1 - 3 years of industry experience in data engineering, with a focus on maintaining and optimizing large-scale data systems.
Expertise in BigQuery, SQL, and Python for data processing, automation, and analysis.
Proven experience with ETL processes and tools.
Familiarity with data visualization tools, especially Looker Studio.
Strong analytical skills and the ability to manipulate, analyze, and interpret large datasets.
Experience in e-commerce marketing, with a strong understanding of platforms like Shopify, Meta (formerly Facebook) Ads, and Google Ads, is a plus.
Self-starter with an entrepreneurial spirit who thrives in a fast-paced environment.


What It’s Like to Work at Darkroom:

We're building the future of advertising and are looking for the minds to help us do it. We only seek out the best—from our clients to our people. Our team is our most sacred asset, and we offer highly competitive salaries and the following perks:


Unlimited Vacation Policy and Holidays: Rebooting is one of the most important parts of growth. At Darkroom, you have access to a flexible vacation policy, and 10 holidays throughout the year to keep you recharged and sharp.
Remote-First Culture: With hubs in LA, The Bay Area, New York, Philly, Lisbon, São Paulo, and Pakistan, we offer a strong community base and endless opportunities for growth.
Endless Opportunities for Growth: Our agency is founded on an interdisciplinary approach, giving Darkroomers insights into services far beyond your job description. Grow your skills and interests beyond your niche and stay at the forefront of the industry through total immersion in cross-functional collaboration.


Equal Opportunity Statement:

Darkroom is an equal opportunity workplace—we are dedicated to equal employment opportunities regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national orientation, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements.


Show more

Title: Data Visualization Engineer - Saudi Arabia
Description:
Make an impact by working for sectors where technology is the enabler, everything is ground-breaking and there’s a constant need to be innovative.

Be part of the team that combines business knowledge, technological edge and a design experience. Our different backgrounds and know-how are key in developing solutions and experiences for digital clients.

Face challenges and learn other ways of thinking and seeing the world - there’s always room for your energy and creativity.

About The Role

The Data Visualization Engineer is responsible for extracting, preparing, and cleansing data, as well as designing and creating visually engaging and informative data visualizations.

As a part of your job, you will:


Collaborate with data analysts and business stakeholders to understand data requirements and objectives for visualization projects.
Connect and integrate visualization tools with various data sources, ensuring seamless and efficient data access.
Extract, prepare, and cleanse data from various sources, ensuring data quality, integrity, and accuracy for visualization purposes.
Design and develop visually engaging and insightful data visualizations using appropriate tools and techniques.



What are we looking for?


BSc and/or MSc in Computer Science or similar;
Previous experience with Data Visualization, Business Intelligence, and ETL processes;
Proficiency in Power BI;
Proficiency in data prep tools or components as Tableau Prep, Power Query, Alteryx, or similar;
Solid understanding of data extraction, preparation, and cleansing techniques to ensure data quality and integrity;
Experience with database management systems, SQL, and various data formats, such as CSV, JSON, and XML;
Ability to connect and integrate visualization tools with various data sources, such as APIs, databases, or data lakes.



Personal traits:

Ability to adapt to different contexts, teams and Clients

Teamwork skills but also sense of autonomy

Motivation for international projects and ok if travel is included

Willingness to collaborate with other players

Strong communication skills

We want people who like to roll up their sleeves and open their minds. Believe this is you? Come join the Team!

Celfocus is a European high-tech system integrator, providing professional services focused on creating business value through Analytics and Cognitive solutions – addressing Telecommunications, Energy & Utilities, Financial Services and other markets' strategic opportunities.

Serving Clients in 25+ countries, Celfocus delivers solutions such as accelerating digital network transformation in Autonomous Networks, elevating and monetising business services in B2B2x ecosystems, and providing highly relevant customer experiences through Hyper-personalisation solutions.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
We’re looking for the special, unique, and amazing YOU!

@ KCS IT, we look for the ones that stands out, for those that always wants to be better and fight for it, and for those who has the same values that we do: dedication, energy, integrity, transparency, flexibility, trust, honesty, hard work, proactivity, teamwork.

At KCS we stand for equality and value diversity. We create a safe, diverse environment where opportunities are equal for everyone! We do not discriminate based on age, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender, disability, or any factor other than merit. All applications with skills for the position are welcome!

We are looking for an Amazing: Data Engineer

Seniority: Senior (5+ years)

Type of position: Hybrid from Coimbra. Candidates must be living in Portugal already!

The amazing you, will have:


Expertise in PySpark
Expertise in SQL
Airflow and GCP is a nice to have
Good English Knowledge
Familiarity with Scala is a bonus
Hybrid model in Coimbra



Why should you become part of our family?


You can develop a career that fits you: your career development is personalized, taking in consideration your needs and goals from a short to long term;
Interesting Challenges Ahead: you can work for several clients from different sectors of activity;
Free training programs: our training and certification programs in languages, tech, behavior and business will help you to reach your full potential faster;
International projects in Benelux: you can gain international experience in Benelux and balance a new way of living with work;
Type of projects (depending on the project you might find one of this types of projects):
In hybrid Systems: Is important to balance work with socialization, that´s why a hybrid system works for us and for you;
Full Remote projects: If you want to work while you enjoy the comfort of your home;
Full Onsite projects: if you prefer the company of your colleagues!

Take care of your well-being: Enjoy our free nutrition, psychologist, general medicine appointments and our yoga and personal training days… all remote!


Who are we?

Founded in 2008 and based in Lisbon, KCS IT is a consulting company in the field of Information Technology and Services, focused on creating value for our clients through three main areas: Consulting, Outsourcing, Innovation and Training. Our commitment to talent development is unmistakable in the recent opening of the Porto and Azores hubs, which aims to develop technology for the national and international market. Since 2018 we have been elected one of the 10 major companies in the “Index of Excellence”, an initiative that aims to reward organizations that invest most in the development and satisfaction of their employees.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Alter Solutions Portugal is an IT Consultancy Company, promoter of Digital Transformation, part of the Alter Solutions Group, created in 2006, in Paris.

In 2022, Alter Solutions joined the act digital group, constituting a global community of talent in Technology, with presence in twelve countries: Germany, Belgium, Brazil, Canada, United States of America, Morocco, Spain, France, Luxembourg, Poland, Portugal and Serbia. Also in 2022, we were certified as a Great Place to Work©.

In Portugal, we partner with over 120 clients and a team of over 500 people, working in projects for industries as diverse as banking, insurance, transportation, aviation, energy, and telecom.

Headquarters of the Nearshore IT center, Alter Solutions Portugal has a dedicated team of around 30 specialized professionals, integrated into projects with several internationally renowned clients.



Job Description


You will work in the capacity of a Data Engineer focusing on the data deliverables for Business and Studio.
Designing and building data models to support Data Science, Business Intelligence, and downstream data sets.
Building APIs and data products to better integrate data throughout our systems and processes.
Monitoring the data pipelines and communicating any issues to leadership and partners.
Working closely with business partners and developers to ensure proper requirements are documented and agreed to for our different initiatives.
Partnering with developers and leadership to coordinate cross-function and cross-team efforts.


Qualifications


Proven experience with Data Engineer/Data Quality Engineer in a fast-paced environment
An expert developer using SQL and SQL-like query languages
Have deep expertise in Python and have experience organizing Python-based projects
Vast Experience with Databricks
Vast Experience with Spark for Big Data
Vast experience with ETL and ELT
Experience with Snowflake
Experience with Cloud AWS and/or Azure

Would be Nice to have:

Experience with Data BuildTool - DBT
Experience with Orchestrators such as Airflow
Have a strong understanding of different data modeling methodologies (Kimball, Inmon, Data Vault)
Experience with IaC's such as Terraform or Cloud Formation
Experience with CI/CD automation - using Jenkins
Show more

Title: Online Data Analyst
Description:
We are hiring freelance Portuguese speaking Online Data Analysts for a project aimed at improving the content and quality of digital maps, which are used by millions of users globally. The job would suit someone who is detail-oriented, likes doing research and has a good knowledge of national and local geography.




This is a freelance position on a flexible schedule - you can work in your own time whenever work is available. You will be completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment, e.g., verifying and comparing data, determining the relevance and accuracy of information. You will be provided with guidelines for each task, which need to be followed. The project offers a variety of tasks, and work is paid per task.




Requirements

Full Professional Proficiency in English & Portuguese
You must be living in Portugal for the last 2 consecutive years
Ability to follow guidelines and do research online using search engines, online maps and website information
You must have familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media and cultural affairs in Portugal
Being open to work across a diverse set of Task Types (e.g. Maps, News, Audio tasks, Relevance)
Applicants must be 18 years or over.




Working on this project will require you to go through a standard recruitment process (including passing an open book assessment). This is a long-term project and your work will occasionally be subject to quality assurance checks.




Why Join the TELUS International AI Community?

Earn extra income
Access to our community wellbeing initiative
Remote work & Location Independence
Be your own boss
Flexible Hours to fit in with your lifestyle
Be a part of an online community




TELUS International AI-Data Solutions partners with a diverse and vibrant community to help our customers enhance their AI and machine learning models. The work of our AI Community contributes to improving technology and the digital experiences of many people around the world. Our AI Community works in our proprietary AI training platform handling all data types (text, images, audio, video and geo) across 500+ languages and dialects. We offer flexible work-from-home opportunities for people with passion for languages. The jobs are part-time, and there is no fixed schedule. Whoever you are, wherever you come from, come join our global AI community. www.telusinternational.com







If you have any questions, do not hesitate to contact us at sourcingteam121@telusinternational.ai

Show more

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
We’re looking for the special, unique, and amazing YOU!

@ KCS IT, we look for the ones that stands out, for those that always wants to be better and fight for it, and for those who has the same values that we do: dedication, energy, integrity, transparency, flexibility, trust, honesty, hard work, proactivity, teamwork.

At KCS we stand for equality and value diversity. We create a safe, diverse environment where opportunities are equal for everyone! We do not discriminate based on age, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender, disability, or any factor other than merit. All applications with skills for the position are welcome!

We are looking for an Amazing: Data Engineer

Seniority: Mid (3-5 years)

Type of position: Full remote in Portugal. Candidates need to be already living in Portugal!

The amazing you, will have:


Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.
4+ years of experience as a Data Engineer, with a focus on Azure cloud technologies.
Strong experience with Azure Data Factory, Azure Databricks, Azure SQL Database, and Azure Synapse Analytics.
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, SQL, and/or Scala.
Experience with data modeling, ETL processes, and data warehousing solutions.
Familiarity with big data technologies and frameworks (e.g., Hadoop, Spark) is a plus.
Solid understanding of data security, privacy, and compliance requirements.
Experience with version control systems (e.g., Git) and CI/CD pipelines.
Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to work effectively in a collaborative team environment.
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to convey complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
Fluent in English.



Why should you become part of our family?


You can develop a career that fits you: your career development is personalized, taking in consideration your needs and goals from a short to long term;
Interesting Challenges Ahead: you can work for several clients from different sectors of activity;
Free training programs: our training and certification programs in languages, tech, behavior and business will help you to reach your full potential faster;

Title: Data Engineer - GCP
HTML:
Decskill, founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company, places paramount importance on its greatest asset: its people. Our main mission is to deliver value through knowledge and talent, and we achieve this by fostering a culture of excellence and investing in the development and well-being of our people. With over 600 dedicated professionals and offices in Lisbon, Porto, Madrid, and Luxembourg, Decskill operates across three core areas:


Decskill Talent: We believe that our people are key to our success.

Through Decskill Talent, we empower our team to embrace the digital transformation challenges of our clients. We collaborate with clients to drive innovation, ensuring project success and business growth.


Decskill Boost: Equipping our team with the latest tools and methodologies, we optimize Time-to-Market and deliver innovative solutions exceeding client expectations.


Decskill Connect: Our team collaborates closely with clients to implement and manage IT infrastructures that generate long-term value.


At Decskill, we believe that by nurturing and empowering our people to confront the challenges of digital transformation, we create value not only for our clients but also for our entire ecosystem, fostering a digital community dedicated to growth and progress.


We are looking for a Data Engineer - GCP for a project based in Porto (hybrid - twice a week at the office).


Responsabilities:

  • Develop, maintain, and optimize data transformation workflows using Google BigQuery;
  • Create and manage views in BigQuery to support data extraction, transformation, and loading (ETL) processes;
  • Collaborate with data analysts and other stakeholders to understand data requirements and translate them into technical solutions;
  • Ensure data accuracy and integrity through regular data quality checks and troubleshooting;
  • Monitor and improve system performance to ensure efficient data processing;
  • Document data transformation processes and maintain comprehensive records of data workflows.


Requirements:

  • Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics or a related field;
  • 2-5 years of experience in a data engineering role, or a similar position, is required;
  • Proficiency with SQL and experience in writing complex queries;
  • Experience with Google BigQuery and other Google Cloud Platform tools;
  • Strong understanding of ETL processes and data transformation techniques;
  • Demonstrable experience with data modeling and data warehousing;
  • Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail;
  • Fluent English (mandatory).


If you’re interested in this job please send your CV in English to catarina.sa@decskill.com with reference “CS/DataEngineer_GCP”.


Decskill is committed to equality and non-discrimination with all our talents. We recruit and promote talent, based on diversity and inclusion, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, race, nationality or any other form of discrimination incompatible with the dignity of the human being.

Title: Data Engineer
HTML:
Chegou o momento de te desafiares a sair da tua zona de conforto fazendo parte de um grande projeto? Vem trabalhar connosco e potenciar ainda mais o teu desenvolvimento!

Integra uma equipa onde trabalharás com os melhores especialistas em Data. Enquanto Engineer, terás a oportunidade de levar os nossos projetos de transformação ao próximo nível, à escala global, criando e entregando soluções inovadoras de Portugal para o mundo. Procuramos perfis que combinem skills de abstração e alguns conhecimentos técnicos da plataforma, com o mindset orientado para a excelência do nosso serviço ao cliente.

Na Deloitte nunca trabalharás sozinho e, por isso, oferecemos um plano de desenvolvimento de carreira com formação ajustada ao teu perfil e aos teus objetivos profissionais. Terás uma experiência profissional que te irá inspirar, ao lado de outros talentos como tu, a transformar o mundo como o conhecemos: a torná-lo mais humano, eficiente e tecnológico. Somos um Tech Hub internacional e estamos à procura dos melhores especialistas em tecnologia para se juntarem aos nossos centros de excelência e à nossa comunidade, para desenvolverem soluções únicas e inovadoras nos mais variados e complexos projetos de transformação.

Estão reunidos todos os ingredientes para poderes embarcar nesta viagem enriquecedora e desafiante que é o mundo Deloitte?

O teu dia a dia e responsabilidades vão ser compostos por:

  • Analise de dados em várias tecnologias, SQL e No-SQL;
  • Desenho, implementação, e monitorização de pipelines ETL;
  • Criação de processos para tratamento de dados (data profiling, cleansing, masking);
  • Desenho e implementação de soluções real-time analytics;
  • Desenho e implementação de soluções Big Data;
  • Desenho e Implementação de soluções data-driven distribuídas com recurso a tecnologias Cloud (AWS, Azure, GCP);
  • Colaborar com vários stakeholders na definição, tratamento de dados e implementação de modelos avançados de Machine Learning.
  • Garantir a coordenação entre equipas técnicas e funcionais no âmbito de projetos de dados;


És tu quem procuramos:

  • Formação superior nas áreas de Engenharia ou similares;
  • Conhecimento da língua Inglesa (oral e escrita) e disponibilidade para viajar; Entre 2 a 6 Anos de experiência profissional em projetos de Data;
  • Conhecimento de processos de desenvolvimento de software;
  • Experiência com metodologias Agile;
  • Conhecimentos de linguagens SQL / No SQL;
  • Conhecimentos em Python;
  • Experiência profissional em soluções ETL (exemplos, Azure Data Fabric, AWS Glue, Snowflake, SSIS, IBM DataStage) (preferencial);
  • Experiência em soluções da Data Visualization (exemplos, Power BI, Tableau);
  • Experiência profissional com Data Warehouses / Data Lakes;
  • Conhecimento das soluções Cloud (AWS, Azure, GCP) orientadas a arquiteturas de dados distribuídos;
  • Experiência profissional em soluções/tecnologias Big Data (exemplos, Kafka, Hadoop, Spark, ELK, MongoDB) (preferencial);
  • Orientação para o cliente e para resultados;
  • Comunicação, trabalho em equipa, resolução de problemas e capacidade analítica.


Desenvolve uma carreira à tua medida

  • Num contexto de trabalho diverso que permite um desenvolvimento e aprendizagem contínuos
  • Através de um plano de desenvolvimento de carreira personalizado (skills/ oportunidades técnicas e funcionais), adequado ao momento, às tuas necessidades e objetivos
  • Participando em projetos nacionais e internacionais, com dimensão e impacto relevante nesta área de especialização
  • Acesso ilimitado às maiores plataformas de aprendizagem online (Linkedin Learning e Udemy
  • Oportunidade de formações e certificações nas mais recentes tecnologias, nomeadamente em tecnologias Cloud


Vive uma cultura de união

  • Uma cultura de inovação e excelência que nos torna líderes e precursores de tendências
  • Um ambiente amigável, de respeito, confiança, transparência e informalidade
  • Uma rede para a vida que te faz estar ligado ao melhor conhecimento ao lado de líderes e especialistas
  • Uma oportunidade para fazeres parte das nossas comunidades (de Tech, desporto e outros interesses) e para participares ativamente em projetos de responsabilidade social.


Sobre a Deloitte

Na Deloitte, nunca trabalharás sozinho. Vais integrar os mais variados e desafiantes projetos e fazer parte do nosso Global Solutions Center, onde poderás colaborar de forma integrada com outras equipas da rede global Deloitte. Terás sempre alguém ao teu lado para te inspirar, ajudar e desafiar a expandir os teus horizontes, enquanto exploras soluções tecnológicas diferenciadoras. Aqui, ao encontrares um ambiente dinâmico, colaborativo e humano, terás a oportunidade de desenvolver a tua melhor versão.

Além disso, as nossas equipas em Portugal têm projeção internacional, o que demonstra a nossa forte liderança global em diversas expertises tecnológicas.

Se tens interesse em explorar e desenvolver as tuas competências e fazer parte de equipas que desenvolvem soluções nas tecnologias líderes de mercado, então estás no lugar certo!

Somos mais de 5.500 pessoas em Portugal, das quais mais de 2.600 trabalham em áreas tecnológicas, a partir de escritórios e Digital Studios em Lisboa, Porto, Viseu, Coimbra e Faro e de polos tecnológicos em Braga, Setúbal e Leiria.

Keywords: Sobre a Deloitte; Consulting; Technology

Title: HR Senior Data Analyst (f/m/div)
HTML:
Are you a data-oriented person with good stakeholder management skills? Do you want to play a role in the future of Infineon’s HR Data Analysis? With your reporting knowledge and data processes savviness, combined with a solid track record of BI solutions deployment, you shall be a valuable addition to our team! Apply now and become part of an innovative team dedicated to driving HR transformation forward! In this role, you will be responsible for developing and delivering state-of-the-art data solutions, as well as further enhancing existing ones. You will act as an expert consultant towards several stakeholders, partnering up with counterparts across different areas in order to translate business needs into fact-based solutions.

In your new role, you will:

  • Develop new self-service data solutions, such as Certified Data Sources, Dashboards, or List Reports;
  • Own and handle existing solutions, namely by troubleshooting & bug-fixing, enhancing & maintaining features throughout life-cycle, enabling & supporting end-users, as well as managing involved stakeholders and relevant communication flows;
  • Trend-scout and consult on data-related matters;
  • Act as topic matter expert for assigned HR pillars data, whilst ensuring a cross-functional scope;
  • Provide guidance to junior colleagues on technical logics and systematics;
  • Support HR & business in taking better, faster, fact-based decisions, driving HR transformation further.

You are proactive, result-oriented and have a structured and self-driven working style. Your strong communication skills allow you to build and leverage solid relations and cooperate with different stakeholders. Furthermore, you have strong analytical skills combined with the ability to develop user-friendly BI solutions to support decision-makers.

You are best equipped for this task if you have:

  • A University degree in Business Administration, Human Resources, Information Technology, or similar field of studies;
  • 3+ years of analytics working experience – ideally linked to Human Resources;
  • Sound knowledge and understanding of reporting solutions & data analysis process, as well as proven experience in identifying trends and visualizing data in order to build value-add solutions for customers;
  • BI software proficiency – both on data flows and visualization ends - preferably Tableau;
  • Analytical and conceptual skills, combined with hands-on spirit and outstanding planning capacity;
  • Team spirit, high attention to detail and stakeholder management experience, preferably in globally operating organizations;
  • Fluency in English (mandatory) – knowledge of German is an advantage.

Please send us your CV in English

Driving decarbonization and digitalization. Together.

Infineon designs, develops, manufactures, and markets a broad range of semiconductors and semiconductor-based solutions, focusing on key markets in the automotive, industrial, and consumer sectors. Its products range from standard components to special components for digital, analog, and mixed-signal applications to customer-specific solutions together with the appropriate software.

  • Welcome at Infineon Technologies Business Solutions in Porto! -

Infineon Technologies Business Solutions is a vibrant global hub, driven by diverse talents and an operational culture of excellence, in a privileged geographic location. The team of more than 25 nationalities works together in a dynamic, diverse and inclusive environment. We lead innovation and digital transformation, shaping the future of Infineon Technologies. At the heart of everything we do, people matter most. Our ultimate goal is to craft a unique experience for both our customers and employees.

At our site you will find a range of diverse teams that have built a reputation for delivering high-quality services for all Infineon in Finance, Procurement, Human Resources, IT, Audit, Legal, Compliance, Business Continuity and Sustainability, Cyber Security, Communication, Corporate Supply Chain Logistics and Sales & Marketing. Porto is a powerhouse of ideas and solutions, a key player in the global company’s puzzle, delivering specialized services and innovative solutions.

Together, Infineon Technologies Business Solutions will continue to shape the future, driving innovation and excellence for years to come.

We are on a journey to create the best Infineon for everyone.

This means we embrace diversity and inclusion and welcome everyone for who they are. At Infineon, we offer a working environment characterized by trust, openness, respect and tolerance and are committed to give all applicants and employees equal opportunities. We base our recruiting decisions on the applicant´s experience and skills.

We look forward to receiving your resume, even if you do not entirely meet all the requirements of the job posting.

Please let your recruiter know if they need to pay special attention to something in order to enable your participation in the interview process.

Click here for more information about Diversity & Inclusion at Infineon.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Decskill, founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company, places paramount importance on its greatest asset: its people. Our main mission is to deliver value through knowledge and talent, and we achieve this by fostering a culture of excellence and investing in the development and well-being of our people. With over 600 dedicated professionals and offices in Lisbon, Porto, Madrid, and Luxembourg, Decskill operates across three core areas:




Decskill Talent: We believe that our people are key to our success.

Through Decskill Talent, we empower our team to embrace the digital transformation challenges of our clients. We collaborate with clients to drive innovation, ensuring project success and business growth.




Decskill Boost: Equipping our team with the latest tools and methodologies, we optimize Time-to-Market and deliver innovative solutions exceeding client expectations.




Decskill Connect: Our team collaborates closely with clients to implement and manage IT infrastructures that generate long-term value.




At Decskill, we believe that by nurturing and empowering our people to confront the challenges of digital transformation, we create value not only for our clients but also for our entire ecosystem, fostering a digital community dedicated to growth and progress.




We are looking for a Data Engineer for a hybrid project based in Porto.




Responsibilities:

Develop, maintain, and optimize data transformation workflows using Google BigQuery.
Create and manage views in BigQuery to support data extraction, transformation, and loading (ETL) processes.
Collaborate with data analysts and other stakeholders to understand data requirements and translate them into technical solutions.
Ensure data accuracy and integrity through regular data quality checks and troubleshooting.
Monitor and improve system performance to ensure efficient data processing.
Document data transformation processes and maintain comprehensive records of data workflows.




Requirements:

Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or a related field.
+2 years of experience in a data engineering role, or a similar position, is required.
Proficiency with SQL Server and experience in writing complex queries.
Experience with Google BigQuery and other Google Cloud Platform tools.
Strong understanding of ETL processes and data transformation techniques.
Demonstrable experience with data modeling and data warehousing.
Experience with other data integration and ETL tools such as Apache Airflow, Talend, or Informatica (Nice to have).
Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Fluency in English.







If you’re interested in this job please send your CV in English to carolina.novais@decskill.com with reference “CN/DE”.




Decskill is committed to equality and non-discrimination with all our talents. We recruit and promote talent, based on diversity and inclusion, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, race, nationality or any other form of discrimination incompatible with the dignity of the human being.

Title: Data Engineer (m/f)
HTML:
Noesis Is Looking For Professionals With The Following Profile

  • Bachelor's degree or higher in Information Technology or Computer Engineering or related field;
  • Minimum 4 years of experience as a Data Engineer;
  • Previous experience working with Python (developing data-related Python frameworks is a plus);

Join us. Let's innovate together!

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
THE TEAM


The Global Client Analytics (GCA) team is responsible for providing data, insights, and analysis to Global Markets front office.
The team aims to build a solid database from various sources and develop analysis, reports and dashboards to provide valuable insight to the Front Office in a rapid, agile manner.
Our team is responsible for multiple steps regarding data processing: Data Feeds industrialization, ETL, Data Warehousing and Data Visualization. We are in direct contact with business sponsors, sales, and traders.
We seek to shape the technologies available to the client’s needs - we plan in processing the data using Python and SQL, while delivering the final product in Tableau, Power BI, APIs, and Chat bots.


Responsabilities


To be part of an international and diverse team who helps Global Markets Front Office to get to know their clients better and identify opportunities and trends throught what data can tell.
As a Data Analyst, you will play a vital role in our team. Working directly with one or more of the bank's business areas, you will provide valuable insights to drive business growth, understading their needs, proposing and implementing data-driven solutions (analysis, visualization and automation). You will exercise a lot of problem identification and problem solving skills.
You will have the opportunity to take ownership of business essential analytical projects that involve retrieving, preparing and analysing complex datasets using data/statistical models and best practices in data visualization for the reporting creation, with the goal to produce insights and automated tools that will guide strategic solutions.
You will move between technical and non-technical areas and should be able to communicate well with different types of professionals. It is very important to be able to clearly and concisely understand stekeholders’ needs and translate these to our technical team, as well as present the results of complex analysis to our stakeholders.
You must be prepared for routine changes, each day will be filled with new and excited challenges.


Mandatory Experience And Knowledge


Academic background in Engineering, Economics, Computing, Mathematics, Statistics or related fields
Availability to work in the hybrid model or in person in the Lisbon or Porto office
Experience in any data visualization tool such as Tableau or Power BI
Experience in data analysis with programming, preferably Python (Pandas)
Proficiency in SQL
Fluency in written and spoken English
Ability to analysze, synthetize and simplify.
Knowledge of descriptive statistics and hypothesis testing is a plus.
Knowledge in Big Data technology such as Pyspark, Presto and Airflow is a plus
Knowledge of Power Query and DAX is a plus
